Pretty sloppy when spending $400+ night. They do nickle dime for other things, and room service is not cheap and not very good either. The pros are great views from the room and service at hotel is very good. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NorCalDiver_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 nights. From our first encounter with the front desk to our last with the valet at checkout the service was fantastic. I booked 2 nights through two different rewards programs. At check in Luis linked the bookings so we would not have to change rooms. He also found us a corner room with both a city and water view with a balcony. I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty pleased would go back...”
Reviews.Author: Rhodestraveled
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Concierge was friendly and helpful. Location can't be beat. Room service breakfast was nice but a couple mins late ( I am a stickler for time ). :). Would definitely go back thank u San Diego and Omni you were so kind!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kdurfee1234
Reviews.Content: Husband and I in SD on business and had planned to rent a car. No need! Public transportation simplest to figure out we've ever seen - from trolley to bus to pedi-taxi! And you can walk easily to convention center, restaurants, seaport village, gaslamp quarter and even a shopping mall/movie theater if you must. The room was clean and super comfortable. Signs of wear beginning to show on main hall carpets/walls. However the customer service was the most remarkable! Friendly, helpful and courteous service at all levels. Excellent workout room! We were remarkably pleased and would definitely choose the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lovemyicecream
Reviews.Content: This was a really great hotel, very friendly staff, very clean, and it was also in the ideal location for exploring San Diego. If you get a deal on this hotel, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very welcoming, AWESOME VIEW OF SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: NPilot98
Reviews.Content: We used to live in San Diego, but we were just visiting for a bowl game, and decided to stay downtown so we could walk back to our hotel from our old favorite watering holes. Great location. Right off the trolley. And the view from our room was amazing, of the bay, looking northward, including Point Loma, Coronado, etc. We could go to the game at Qualcomm via the trolley, super easy! We will definitely consider this place again next time we are visiting San Diego. One negative is parking is expensive, but I think I had it added to my room bill.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: pmoratto
Reviews.Content: Cons first: you pay nearly 275 a night and they nickel and dime you for internet. That's just tacky. This is a major down side for business travelers. Pros: everything else. The front desk staff are actually smart and took care of a credit card authorization with my company very effortlessly. It's nice to find people who work in customer service who are efficient when something out of the norm comes up. The location is totally prime and the rooms are somewhere between standard and high end. If they get the internet situation resolved I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SDFifield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there this past weekend. We joined friends for the Padres game and combined it with my birthday. This hotel has a conveinent bridge conecting the hotel to the stadium. This hotel is within walking distance to several attractions ( Seaport Village, Horton Plaza, Gaslamp District, Convention Center, the Trolley). This is my favorite hotel in the Omni chain. I would recommend it to anyone. Every time I am in San Diego, this is where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: xsears
Reviews.Content: We are from the midwest and love to visit San Diego. When yo go no need for a car the Omni is the perfect location!we have stayed at many different locations in San Diego and the Omni is the best.No need fo us to look any place else when we getr back there we will always stay with them. Great hotel, great service, friendly staff, I cant imagine a better San Diege stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Jackson B
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 2 night stay. From the time you pull up to the time you leave everyone is very nice. The concierge was very helpful, parking attendant quick and the front desk staff friendly. The place is spotless as was the room. It is very convenient to the gaslamp district, as well as the sports stadium and convention center. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Omni Hotel, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: laineygirl68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in July 2011 for 8 days, it was a trip for his 60th birthday. the hotel made it a very special stay for us. The rooms are lovely and clean with everything that you could need, the maid service is excellent. The staff at reception was helpfull and very polite. Could not recommend this hotel enough, and being attached to the baseball field was a big plus for us. Would like to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ccwhite
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, convenient to everything you need or need to go. Everyone was friendly, and professional...Everything was super clean and everyone seemed happy to be there, including the staff. The room was nice and clean, gorgeous view, gorgeous pool, and was next to the stadium with its own walkway. Love this place! Cant wait to return...definite return customer!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: LovetoeatoutTucson
Reviews.Content: What can I say we had a blast! We flew into San Diego, Rode the bus to the trolley station and hoped the trolley which stopped 100ft from the Omni! The hotel staff was incredible! Friendly staffs, clean room, ideal location - what else can you ask for! No need to rent a car - the Omni is in the center of everything. The trolley is convenient and the even have a bridge going right over to Petco Park - Home of the Padres! We walked Gas-Lamp Quarter, ate at many of the local restaurants (The Mission, Richard Walkers Pancake House, and rode the trolley to Little Italy to eat at Fillipis). A short walk away is Seaport Village, and the Water Taxi to Coronado Island (Try the Burger Lounge)! The beds were comfortable, The Shower pressure was great, and we had a view of the Bay! There is a Starbucks in the Gift Shop - Fresh water - cucumber one day, Lime the next, just perfect! Took my wife of 30 Years! - And we just had fun! Very relaxing and only a short trolley ride from Old Town (wE caught a bus and went down to Mission Beach). Our flight left late and they welcomed the storage of our luggage. I highly recommend the San Diego Omni!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Omni Hotel, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: HikingGal1961
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Omni Hotel in San Diego. I was there with a gal friend on vacation Sept. 2011to see the SF Giants play the Padres. We stayed 3ni 4days. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and roomy. We did not know this but there is a pedestrian bridge that connects directly from the 4th floor to PetCo ballpark! Easy access and no lines to get in! We enjoyed the restaurant called McCormick & Schmicks! We had two meals there. Both dinners. The first meal we ate at the bar. The second, we sat in a booth. Both dinners were delicious!! We could not be more happy with the service in both the hotel and the restaurant. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay there again. The only disappointment was that the bathroom did not have any shelving for our personal items. No room to put stuff. No shower caddy either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tucsondowntown
Reviews.Content: I came to San Diego for a conference at the Hilton at the waterfront and ended up at the Omni because the Hilton was full at the rate I desired. I am very glad I ended up at the Omni. The Omni is wonderfully located - right at the entrance to the Gaslamp District, adjacent to the ball park, and across the way from the convention center. The front desk was very polite and helpful. My room was a good size, nicely appointed and clean. The bed was very comfortable. I am very picky about hotels, especially cleanliness; I enjoyed my stay and would stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: lucie47
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. we had a great corner room with a fantastic view overlooking the harbor. the service was outstanding. the concierge was very helpful. We would go back there in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room with views to the San Diego Padres Stadium!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: crisss80
Reviews.Content: loved that place. Personnel very helpful and courteous. Nice swimming pool and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: pyry
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain but you should not have when a hotel room costs about 300 Dollars / night. Very nice rooms, clean, pleasant. Nice little pool area. Stayed there 9 nights in July.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for young married couples”
Reviews.Author: Shaun_Fitz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our California trip for four nights. The staff was great and very accommodating. The location is tremendous as the gas lamp district is great for good food and late drinks. The pool is awesome. We considered other places, and we definitely made the right decision!

Reviews.Title: “Ok property, if there isn't a wedding and convention”
Reviews.Author: marco1234_2011
Reviews.Content: Right across from the convention center...steer clear if their is a convention in town. We were lucky enough to share the hotel with attendees of the world conference of narcotics anonymous....so the attendees were questionable. Also there was a wedding poolside outside our room playing VERY loud music, which made it impossible to enjoy our room. The view was horrible over the pool and shipping terminal/train station. Parking was expensive at more than 35 a day. Proximity to the ballpark was a good thing. Won't stay here again - nothing special, would go to Coronado or other areas....for $200 it's not that nice.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: patwong03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for leisure and had a great time. Pros - Clean, sleek rooms with modern designs. Very close to the Gaslamp Quarter (Fifth Avenue) and is VERY lively at night, although some places close at 10pm. Good gym and excellent pool/jacuzzi. Had one of the best massages of my life here (think her name was Karen). Also has cable TV, including HBO (so parents, be careful). There are also shuttles to take you around town. Cons - Internet is $9.95 a day but free if you sign up for their rewards program (a little sleazy, but not a big deal). Pillows gave me a neck cramp and the bathroom door doesn't lock (as it's a sliding door) which is a little annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nyormirror
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a wonderful week long stay at the Omni on our vacation. The front desk staff, security, food service and housekeeping were very friendly and professional. We had a bay/cityview room on the 19th floor that limited the train noise and provided awsome views. Join Omni select guest for free wi-fi, two freee beverages in the morning by room service, and 2 presed items. I would also recommend self parking at the ACE lot at K and 6th for $8 weekday and walk a half block to the hotel instead of the $30 plus tip valet parking that is offered by the hotel. The hotel has earned their 4 star rating and I would absolutely stay here when I come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “WHO NEEDS A BASEBALL GAME?”
Reviews.Author: MMPJMH
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, the San Diego Padres were playing out of town during our 3-night stay at the Omni. Good thing, too -- because that meant no sports distractions to keep us away from all the fun the Omni provides. Truth in Advertising Moment: we stayed at the Omni Austin last year and loved it so much we gave their San Diego property a try. We were not disappointed. How may I count the ways: Room (Loyalty Ambassador Janelle made our request for a corner view room with a balcony a reality); Pool (softest lounges ever made, best poolside service imaginable, especially from Laura!); Housekeeping (it's as if they sense when you are gone, even if for a short period, and in they come like elves to make everything as spotless as the day you checked in); Service (Sean was Mr. Hospitality from our car to the room on arrival and even helped put smiles back on our faces when we had to check out); the Lobby Coffee/Snack Shop (don't dare walk in grumpy because it won't last as the lady running the place is so full of good cheer you can't help but join her in feeling just great about everything -- including the Starbucks coffee and array of breakfast goodies). Sorry, Padres, we got along just fine without you.

Reviews.Title: “super staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonathan19280
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni need to be congratulated for such friendly and efficient service. Always welcoming you with a smile, chatting with you and going that extra mile to ensure you leave thinking "I wasnt just another guest". If I had to suggest anything to the hotel staff I would say upgrade the lifts, they can be a bit slow during busy times in the morning or evening.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay if you're going to Padres game”
Reviews.Author: trucker64
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Omni. The walkway from the hotel to Petco park was great. Large room but queen beds would have been nice. Didn't like the 29-35$ per night valet charge. Good location, easy to get to most attractions. Free internet if you join Omni Select Guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but one disappointing event lingers..”
Reviews.Author: tlh02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in mid August for 5 days with our 2 young daughters. I'll start out first with all the positive aspects of the hotel because there are so many. First off, we requested and received 2 connecting rooms. The rooms are a nice size, clean, and beautifully furnished. We also had a great view of the city, bay and convention center. The hotel is directly next to Petco Park with a bridge connecting the hotel and Park. This allows for in and out access throughout the game. Baseball fans will really love staying so close to the park. There is excitement in the air during home stays and you will see players in the hotel as well. At the pool you can hear the fans cheering and from the top floors you can catch a glimpse of the game from the hallway windows. There are endless dining options all within blocks of the hotel. You can find any type of food and choose a casual or more upscale option. The pool is fantastic and warm. The girls loved going for a swim each afternoon. The lounge chairs are comfortable and the wait staff is very friendly and attentive. The food and drinks by the pool are reasonably priced. The valet staff was fast retrieving our car and helpful with directions when needed. The doorman David was very friendly and always willing to offer directions or advice when asked. Justin the concierge offered some good food options close to the hotel and also in La Jolla. People have mentioned taking public transportation to get around the San Diego area but with smaller children I would recommend a car. We never had much difficulty finding parking. I also must note that the Omni is very family friendly. That is the main reason we choose this hotel over others. The children always felt welcome and the guests didn't seem to mind their presence. There are many families in the hotel but the children are all well behaved and do not seem to effect the stay of couples or business travelers traveling without children. Now onto the negative....having said all these positive things I hate to bring up the negative but this one experience left a lasting impression that just won't go away. Halfway into our stay we were woke up at around 1:30am by lound partying that began at the elevator and continued in the room next door. This noise not only woke us up but our daughter sleeping next door. Once it becuase clear that the party was not going to end I called the front desk. They noted my concern and immediately sent security up. After finally opening the door there was a lound confrontation with security that spilled into the hallway with yelling and screaming. After yelling into the telephone and slamming drawers the noise did die down, 2 hours later. Needless to say sleep is a major reason for vacation and there was very little sleep that night. The next morning while in the shower my husband receives a knock at the door. It was after 8am and I assumed it was management checking up on us to appologize for the inconvience of the night before. I was wrong. It was security addressing a noise complaint about our children. The security guard was very nice and understood the children weren't being loud. He knew about the incident the night before and realized it was an immature attempt at retaliation. He also discussed the idea of moving us to a new room. I immediately went to the front desk and spoke with the day manager. I wanted him to know that we were happy and well settled into our current room and that we did not want to move. I did, however, want him to know that there was no way I was going to lose another night of sleep. He assured me that the guest next door would be checking out by noon and that it would not be a problem. I do not blame the Omni for how the situation was handled at the time of the incident. Unfortunately you sometimes get a bad next door neighbor. I can't imagine why someone would think it was ok to party at the Omni. If they wanted to party the Hard Rock Hotel is directly across the street. What I was disappointed in was the lack of concern by management. No one called to appologize for the lost night of sleep I recieved. No one inquired about how the children handled the yelling in the hallway. I don't think they realized what an inconvience it was to us. It would have been really simple to leave a positive impression. A handwritten note left in our room to show they recognized our discomfort would have been appreciated. A plate of cookies for the girls saying they hoped they enjoyed the rest of their stay would have went a long way. A free breakfast for one night would have said a lot and showed management cared. None of this would have taken must time or cost the hotel more than a few dollars. Instead we got no acknowledgement of what happened the night before. No phone call, no written note. So instead of remembering all the great things about the Omni and there were many, we remember an opportunity lost. I would still recommend the Omni to a friend but I would make sure they know there are lots of other hotels with similar pricing in the area. I would tell them there are lots of employees at the Omni that are great at their job and make you feel special. I just wouldn't include management in this list.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: redladya
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! We got a great AAA rate-$167 for a room with a bay view. They ended up giving us a corner room with a balcony-very nice! The only thing I didn't like is the fact that the bathroom is open to the bedroom (louvered doors & louvers also in the wall between bed & bath). Loved the fact that it's attached to Petco Park. They also gave us a voucher for buy one/get one free breakfast in the hotel, so it ended up being an even better deal than we expected. Very comfortable room, will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Izk_KC
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. We had friends staying at the Hard Rock and the Omni is right across the street so it worked out perfectly. We needed a crib and a fridge and we had it immediately without any issues at all. The room was clean and comfortable. Although one interesting thing was that the bathroom door didn't latch. It just slid closed to cover the opening. If you need privacy from others staying with you in your room, then this could be a concern. It wasn't an issue for us. We were able to get from the airport and back as well as to the zoo and back (with a toddler) with public transportation. Add in that the hotel is right at the Gaslamp District and the location couldn't have been much better. Also they gave us a small bag of toys for our daughter. Nothing amazing, but a small thoughtful gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Perfect location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lagunanina
Reviews.Content: Both the service and the location at the Omni was excellent. The reception desk was friendly and helpful and check-in was a breeze. The hotel is within short walking distance to the Gas Lamp District, the Convention Center, the marina, and the trolley. It was a very short drive to Little Italy, with many delicious Italian restaurants, and Balboa Park was also not far. There is also a good restaurant "McCormick and Schmidt" in the hotel, where we enjoyed a delicious breakfast with wonderful service. The only thing that wasn't perfect was the pedestal sink in the bathroom which didn't leave much space for toiletries. Other than that, our stay was perfect. The service was great and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, next to Gaslamp and the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: JDnt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for a week during a conference in the Convention Center. Best location, walking distance to the Convention Center. A few steps to Gaslamp quarter, to tons of restaurants (Italian, Thai, American, Mexican, etc). Very friendly staff, and an awesome service. Cant wait to go back and definitively staying at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “In a word...pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: tbtennistx
Reviews.Content: Truly a delightful stay. This hotel has worked with their employees on customer service. To the management: It has paid off. Each time a request is made, the answer is not a problem, my pleasure, or sure thing. If the request cannot be granted, there is a logical explanation. While we didn't have alot of requests. Simple things like a microwaving a leftover pizza were no problem. Needing a blow dryer in the spa area shower, no problem. Things are taken care of, with a smile being the added bonus. The property is very convenient to the stadium (connected) and also the fine establisments in the Gaslamp area. The hotel is immaculent in every way. The fitness/spa area is equipped with top of the line equipment and plenty of machines. The pool area has wonderful towels that are nicely appointed on the very comfy lounge chair. Again, the bonus is the 5 star service. The waitstaff is friendly and strolls through with cups of cucumber water and then later pineapple water. The food poolside is also outstanding. If you want a place to stay where you are treated like someone special from the minute you get out of your car/taxi...this is it. We were spolied for three nights and sad to leave. Lastly, my 8 year old son loved the milk and cookie upon our arrival. There is so much for kids to love about the hotel. The decor and also the access to MLB baseball players milling around.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Padres weekend with those pesky SF Giant Fans”
Reviews.Author: gmcwalker
Reviews.Content: I was able to book this hotel 4 months ago and stay there several weeks ago for a weekend with my friends and my brother who flew down from the SF Bay area to see the Padres play the Giants. From top to bottom this Hotel was a great place. It also connected to the ballpark with a private enterance and exit for hotel guests. There was a great pool area with a hot tub and a bar and grille right there for lunch. There were many people there including some of the Giants players and their families as that was the team hotel for them. Their restaurant was McCormick and Schimits at the Hotel. A great Happy Hour early and then it reappeared later that night. Great food for $4 or less. All week long. The rooms were fine but came with earplugs as they are next to the ballpark and some of the nearby hotels have rooftop bars/clubs that get loud late. Now there are some reviews here complaining about noise but I did not find it a problem as it was not that bad and I did use earplugs as I always do when ever I stay in a city. The best part was running into the SF Giants players in the Hotel. All of them were very nice to the kids from the Panda to the Beard. Mr. Tim was cool too as a youngster from Palo Alto told me.. All in all it was a great weekend at a great hotel with great friends. And that is what it is all about. P.S. I used PL

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: pxcardi60
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni San Diego Hotel was the perfect place to stay while in San Diego. The staff were very friendly and eager to assist in directions, free bottles of water, suggestions for dining etc. The pool is on the terrace and while we were taking pictures, fireworks went off on the bay! The worst part...having to check out and go back home. The rooms were clean and had a great view of the Padre stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: tomcardinal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni in order to attend a Padres game and go to the Del Mar horse races. By joining Omni's frequent stay program we were able to check in online two days before our arrival and request a 1 PM check in time. When we arrived at 1 PM we simply grabbed our keys located on the board attached to the wall beside the front desk and went to our room. Our friends who we were traveling with had to wait until around 2:30 PM to get into their room. If you are going to see a Padres game, I cannot imagine a better place to stay. There is a walkway from the hotel to the ballpark. You can leave and return to the game if you choose to. There were also two other Padre games that we did not attend while staying at the hotel. We didn't experience any significant traffic delays when the games were going on and we were doing other things. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. There were two big positives for us with the room. The bed was very comfortable. I'd like to buy it. Both nights we both slept well, which isn't typically the case when we sleep in hotel beds. Also, the climate control in the room worked great. We couldn't hear it or feel the air blowing on us. One negative was that there was not much of sound barrier between the bathroom and the larger room, so if you are staying in the room with someone else, hopefully you know them really well. The front desk people were very helpful in getting some items printed off an email and a website for me. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. Tons of restaurants to choose from in Gaslamp area. Best meal we had though, was at Bankers Hill, which is not acutally in Gaslamp, but pretty close by. The food was superb and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NavyDad03
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with nice sized rooms that are excellently appointed and most of them have great views. The ttaff is very courteous and the valets really hustle your car to you. The Gaslamp District and Waterfront/convention center are right there.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TrabFamily
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary here and had a really nice time. Loyalty Ambassador Janelle checked us in, which only took about 2 minutes. She knew we were celebrating our anniversary and hadn't been away from the kids in quite a while. Later that afternoon, a complimentary bottle of champagne and a tray of delicious chocolate covered strawberries surprised us in our room. It was a very nice gesture which we appreciated greatly. We walked all around downtown San Diego and the Gaslamp area. Had a delicious dinner at McCormick & Schmidts. Didn't get in the car until it was time to leave. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, convenient to convention center”
Reviews.Author: sunbubble1
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference and, since I registered late (my fault), we had to pay the standard rate instead of the convention rate. Our first impression was not great: we checked in after 11 pm and there was no one in front of the hotel and no one to help us with our luggage. When we checked into our room, however, we discovered that we probably had the most beautiful room in the hotel. It was a huge corner room with views of the ocean and the old section of the city and a balcony!!! It's so wonderful to be able to open a window (or balcony door) to let some fresh air in!! The rest of our time there was very nice, if sometimes inconsistant. The room was spotless, the service was excellent. We were supposed to receive a local paper every day but only received it one day. When I mentioned it, the front desk claimed that another guest must have stolen it, but they didn't offer another paper. Also, when I asked the concierge for a "reasonable" casual nearby restaurant, he recommended the most expensive and formal restaurant we have ever been to. We had invited some other attendees to go with us (who were on a per diem) and I was terribly embarassed by the cost of the meal! Other than those issued, this is a really nice hotel and we would stay there again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Padre games”
Reviews.Author: cbadm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel to see a Padre/Giants game at Petco. The room was large and they delivered milk and cookies for bedtime snack. Nice view of the ballpark infield from our room. The staff was very friendly. If you are going to the ballpark, you can walk across a special 3rd floor bridge between Petco Park and the hotel. Pool was nice and poolside snacks receive good reviews from kids. The location is great for touring the gaslamp district for nightlife and shopping. Only downside was the $30 per night parking per car. We had two cars so paid double. Ouch. Nice breakfast in hotel at McCormicks.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: v99
Reviews.Content: the good: comfortable bed excellent service mccormick and schmick restaurant is consistently fresh and good sooo close to the convention center the bad: bathrooms in room are worn out - stained, cracked tile - rust stains in sink bathroom offers no privacy - has a semi private sliding door - feels as if you are in the bedroom the lighting! overhead florescent lighting in the bathroom gives the appearance of bloodshot, baggy eyes and yellow teeth. Yuck Coffee in the coffee shop is terrible. Says Starbucks, but tastes like watered down maxwell house.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ALISTER54
Reviews.Content: I had read all the great reviews about the Omni and once again the reviewers got it spot on. Fantastic location just minutes away from the Gaslamp entertainment district. We went to a Padres game and to walk straight into the stadium via the walkway was superb. The hotel has great rooms and the staff really are first class, every single member of the staff were brilliant from the moment we arrived. We just could not have enjoyed our stay more. Just one complaint $35 a day to park ! That is the most expensive I have paid anywhere. If you are visiting San Diego on holiday, this hotel really is the best.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: kk1
Reviews.Content: I requested a month ago saying that we are celebrating our boy's birthday. The first day we got a cake some chocolates and goodies - very thoughtful people. The room is very nice and the bathroom is very spacious too. The down side is that valet parking is very $$$$ so make sure park at the ACE parking garage across from the hotel. The swimming pool is very beautiful too but we don't have time to swim, maybe next time

Reviews.Title: “Walking into the Padres Petco ballpark right from hotel, priceless!”
Reviews.Author: KLaguna
Reviews.Content: Okay so this hotel is awesome. Five stars all around. Loved the high end decor in the rooms and hotel. We had the time of our lives. Walked across a little special hotel guests only access bridge between the hotel and Petco right into the ball park. Magical. Also must try the "crab cake eggs benedict" for breakfast from room service, soooo good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: KrisCapo13
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Omni San Diego. I am just finishing up a 10-night stay. I came out here for a conference and some other work related activities. It is an excellent location for both work and pleasure. The convention center is a 3-minute walk and the gaslamp district begins right out the front door. If you sign-up for the Omni's hotel reward program the $10/night fee for internet is waived. Other perks of the hotel reward program include a complimentary drink of your choice delivered to your room each morning, turn-down service and a newspaper. Even during a very busy time...conference going on and the Padres were playing the Giants, the staff was very accommodating. There is direct access to the Petco Park from the hotel lobby, which makes it very easy to go to a ball game. The only slightly negative is the high prices for valet parking ($35/weekday and $29/weekend). However, these are comparable rates to the rest of the city. Love the hotel, location and staff. Highly recommend for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: umu
Reviews.Content: Stayed there attending a conference. Overall very good experience.Nice big room and bathroom with tub and shower..Good bedding.Some noise from trains passing by. Breakfast for a european just so and so all those eggs but no fresh bread ,only toast. Nice bar.Superb location for the gaslamp quarter and conference hall. Very good concierge and reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: EagleMountainRR
Reviews.Content: This is truly a first class, five star hotel. The hotel is in a great location for visits to the Gaslamp Quarter, PETCO Park, San Diego Convention Center and much more. The hotel is very modern, very clean, and well maintained. The staff is excellent. I used there express on-line check-in...I was literally at the front desk maybe 10 seconds and I had my keys and was ready to go. If your visiting neighboring PETCO Park, make sure to use there skybridge which direct access to the park. The only "negative" I have to say about this hotel is they charge you for wifi service. I seems that with the high price you pay for a room here, it would be included.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: starmarie10
Reviews.Content: Very nice, full-service hotel. The rooms are clean, it's quiet and there's a great view of the bay if your room is facing it. The location is the perfect for the Gaslamp District. Only has valet parking at $29 a night, which is outrageous but you can park overnight in the close parking garage for $16 but you'll need cash to pay at the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jvdp11
Reviews.Content: 2nd time stay here for us. It was again as expected. When you stay here, make sure to register yourself as select guest at their website (its free). This will give you free internet access (normally 9,95), every morning two complimentary beverages delivered to your room and a free newspaper. The staff was ver friendly. Location is perfect for visiting the nice Gaslamp Quarter. The parking costs for valet was about 30 bucks a night, that was the only downside for us. The overall stay and experience were perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Musikaats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni because a family wedding was held there. The hotel had a great location in the Gaslamp District, walking distance to many attractions. The staff was helpful and we had great service from every staff member we had contact with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: bellson88
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a wedding and really enjoyed it! Pros: The location was great, the rooms were decently sized and updated, and their outdoor wedding venue was perfect for a summer wedding. Cons: There were very few outlets and no lock on the bathroom door (this may be an issue if you are sharing a room with someone) and there was always a long line to valet your car.

Reviews.Title: “really nice in every way”
Reviews.Author: susangz
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego on a business trip and stayed three nights at the Omni. I have only nice things to say about it. The room was lovely with high quality linens, toiletries, nice lighting, spacious, etc. As an Omni Select guest (I don't even know how I got that status), I had free wifi and fresh coffee and a newspaper delivered to my door for free each morning. The outdoor pool - big enough for real lap swimming - is open at 5 a.m. which is great for those of us still functioning on eastern time zones. The pool is heated and on the foggy cool mornings of my stay, I really enjoyed jumping into the adjacent jacuzzi. The exercise facilities are also more than adequate. The staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. The only cautionary note is that one should check the Padres' schedule or whether there is a concert at the Padres' stadium before you book. The hotel is right next to the stadium and, if you're not involved in the stadium activity, you might not like the noise and crowds. The stadium was empty the weekend I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: marcgr
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service from all the staff at the hotel! I checked in and they didn't have a room immediately available (it was the weekend of the Rock & Roll Marathon and they said they had a lot of late check-outs). Even though they said the wait would be less than an hour, I explained that my plane was late and I had to prepare for a meeting with two of my company's VPs , so they upgraded me to a suite with a bedroom, very large bathroom, and separate sitting area with sofa and chairs. Nice! Thanks!! The suite worked out really well, I ended up holding several meetings in my hotel room over the course of the week. The flat-screen TV in the sitting area is driven by a VGA cable so I was able to plug in my laptop and run powerpoint presentations on the 42" TV while the VPs were sitting comfortably on the sofa. If you are thinking of using the suite to share between multiple people it might not work - the room's thermostat is in the sitting area but the AC vent is in the bedroom so if you have the door between the sitting area and bedroom closed, then the sitting area gets hot and the bedroom gets cold. But if you don't mind having the door between the sleeping area and the sitting area open then it's no big deal. Location is across the street from the convention center but if your conference is in the higher-lettered halls (D, E, F, G) then you are actually closer to the convention at the Omni than at the other hotel that is actually attached to the convention center. The hotel is connected to the baseball stadium and I arrived just as a game was about to start. Taxi drivers know how to deal with the traffic but if you are driving your own car you might want to call the hotel to ask where to go. This hotel has done the right thing with their restaurant and instead of trying to establish some lame own-brand restaurant in the hotel, they brought in a high-end franchise (McCormick & Schmick's) to run their restaurant/bar area. We were thoroughly impressed with the restaurant and the service from our server Alison and the other staff. I reviewed it separately here: http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60750-d496884-r114189342-McCormick_Schmick_s-San_Diego_California.html#REVIEWS Concierges were great, check-out was as easy as check-in and again great service from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: rockies411
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early June for 2 nights for business. Upon checking in, I asked for a room on a high floor. The room I received was facing the bay and was incredible. It was quiet and had all of the normal amenities of a nice hotel. I travel 50-60 nights per year and this hotel was one of the nicest, well maintained I have seen in some time. The location is outstanding. The Gaslamp district AND Petco Park are literally out the front door. I had no issue with noise like some of the other posts. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Baseball Fans - All American Baseball Package*****”
Reviews.Author: IrvineBeary
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this hotel was on "Good Friday" to see the Phillies & Padres play. The OMNI staff was fantastic. I shared emails with them before my stay and felt very welcome when my family checked into the hotel. The Valet parking staff were very couretous and gave us dining tips for the "Old Town Area" which is around the corner from the hotel. For the true baseball fan visting San Diego the OMNI is the place to stay. Firstly, the visting MLB teams all stay at this hotel which is attached directly to PETCO Park by the 4th floor pedestrian bridge. On our Sat. departure, after breakfast in the hotel lobby, we were fortunate to meet up with the Phillies Manager & some of the players. Book your stay through OMNI's website with the "All American Baseball Package" . This package included the Valet parking, (2) tickets to the baseball game, $40.00 in dining credits at McCormick & Schmidt (Lobby location) and some Apple Pie and beverages delivered to your room. Start your baseball visit with a behind's the scene tour of PETCO park both of the guides gave our group a terrific tour . It was a great bargain at only $12.00. For the Sports Bar fans, go to "Bubs" around the corner and next to PETCO Park, you might even meet your favorite teams sports stars as we did. The service was quick and the prices were moderate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't pick a better location or a nicer hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleibson
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of things San Diego, I can't imagine a better place than the Omni San Diego. My wife and I stayed here for a convention. The convention center is across the street. Petco Park where the Padres play is attached to the hotel by a sky bridge and they played every day we were there. The Gaslamp District where all of the restaurants and boutiques are located is just outside of the hotel's front door as is a stop on the local light rail line to take you anywhere you might want to go for a couple of bucks. Hotel amenities are very comfortable and we had a great view of the Bay. There's a McCormicks fish restaurant in the hotel and the gift shop serves Starbucks drinks and has muffins, bagels, and pastries for inexpensive breakfasts. The staff was super nice every day. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location! Stunning Views!”
Reviews.Author: MAGLUVSTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: After reading the Tripadvisor reviews I was a little hesitant to stay at the Omni, but WOW, was I pleasantly surprised! The Omni is a beautiful hotel centrally located between the Convention Center, the Padres Stadium and the Gaslamp District – and just minutes from the airport. This is where I will stay on future trips to San Diego! I stayed in a corner room on the 12th floor (1204) for two nights. The room was small, but beautifully appointed. I loved the fact that the room had four large windows that overlooked the Padres Stadium, Coronado Bridge and the Pacific Ocean. However, the room was surprisingly quiet and peaceful. I didn’t eat at the hotel restaurant, McCormick & Schmidt’s, but I did go downstairs each morning to the Starbucks – very convenient. There are small coffee makers in the room if you prefer. Every staff member I encountered was polite, friendly and helpful. The pool and gym are on the 6th floor. I used the gym twice – it was very clean and well appointed with new equipment and weights as well as hand towels, disinfecting wipes, headphones, and bottle water. The pool area is very elegant – loved the padded lounges and drink service. Make sure to sign up for the Omni Select loyalty program – it’s free and includes lots of freebies such as free internet, bottled water, late check out, etc. What to know • 5 minutes from airport • Very contemporary décor in rooms • Pedestal sink in bathroom / shelves on either side • Dozens of amazing restaurants within walking distance • Walkway connecting the hotel to the Padres Stadium • Freight train line is near hotel, so you may hear a train horn in the middle of the night • Valet parking is $35 per night

Reviews.Title: “So much noise- couldn't sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Erin74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Omni for several nights in December 2010. I was there on business and spent a lot of time in the hotel's ballroom and meeting rooms attending various events. While the hotel is lovely, well-maintained and nicely located in San Diego, the constant noise from the train and Convention Center made it impossible for me to sleep, even with the earplugs provided by the hotel. This made for an unpleasant stay. My room looked directly onto the train tracks and Convention Center, with views of the Bay beyond. I thought it was a little odd that the hotel had placed ear plugs on the bedside table, but when I tried to go to sleep that first night, I realized the problem quickly. The train goes by regularly, even at night, blasting its horn the whole way. I was woken up repeatedly, which made for a very poor night's sleep. Then, starting at about 6am, a large crowd assembled outside the Convention Center, cheering and shouting (who knew you could get so excited about a convention starting in the wee hours?!). It was ridiculous. I got practically no sleep. The Omni really should have done a better job of soundproofing these rooms. In their current state, I could not recommend them to anyone. I don't know if the noise level is this bad in other parts of the hotel, but if you must stay here, definitely request a room that faces the Gaslamp and not the Convention Center. The noise is a shame, because pretty much every other aspect of my stay at The Omni was positive. The hotel is nicely updated and looks lovely. Check-in was quick and easy. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Food at the McCormick's restaurant in the lobby was good. Meeting facilities in and around the ballroom were great. The proximity to the Gaslamp is wonderful-- we were able to get out to nice dinners either on foot or via a short cab ride. I imagine this would be a great place to stay during baseball season, as well, given that the hotel has a footbridge that will take you directly to Petco Park. However, none of these positive items could make up for the fact that I spent several weary nights just trying to get a little sleep and being constantly disturbed by the noise. It's a big problem and I wouldn't stay here again as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bilah1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Omni during Memorial Day weekend May 27-30th and had a great time. Conveniently located in the gaslamp district across Petco Park. The only negative is they have a "late night menu" that restricts your options for room service. Valet is expected at $30.00+ a day like most downtown locations. Me being from Chicago area our hotels have similar rates. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: MCSallyG
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here on our southern california road trip holiday it was a fantastic location, great staff and we had a great deal that included parking and breakfast each day. This is the second Omni we have stayed in and have had great experiences both times. We went to the baseball and it was great as it was so close and had it's own access bridge so we didn't have to deal with any of the crowds. It was easy access to bars and resturants in the Gas Lamp Quater, some hotels in the area seemed to be on streets that didn't look too safe at night so we were very happy with the location as we hadn't been there before and some of the hotels we considered seemed to be in some sketchy blocks. The conceirge gave us fantastic resturant recommendations every night. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Reliable Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MdEst
Reviews.Content: Great choice if you are attending a Padres game and looking for a clean, comfortable hotel. Yes, it's got a bit of the austere corporate convention center hotel feel to it but meets most of the checklist if you need something reliable and well located with good value. Only potential negative from a sleep quality perspective was the thumping electronica well past midnight at the rooftop bar a block north. Sounded like a great party but beware if you are a light sleeper and get a room facing north.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Creature Comforts & San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ChiefJack
Reviews.Content: Having been to San Diego for conferences in the past, I was looking forward to attending this business meeting, this hotel helped make it one of the best. Omni Hotels brand is a great customer service focused enterprise. Check in was very welcoming, card-keys waiting. I got a mid-level floor. Every morning had OJ, coffee, and a paper waiting for me. Simple pleasures so far from home. The hotel decor was subtle-chic and staff unobtrusive. Hotel bar food tasty. Lobby bar very expensive, but not to worry, the Gas lamp district is right outside the door. Extra-ordinary selection of restaurants for foodies (also, visit the Palm Steakhouse a few blocks away) Conference Rooms were fine seats were comfortable. Better yet, when interrupted for a phone call, you can walk out on the veranda and speak in 70 degree San Diego sun while the Santa Fe railroad cars slowly coast by. I understand why people love San Diego. Rooms were well appointed, not ostentatious. Toiletries are among the best in the industry. Everything in the city is within walking distance. The convention center is across the street. This is the only place i would stay for another convention.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, awesome location, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nikkipell31
Reviews.Content: Our main purpose was to go to San Diego and to head to a Phillies/Padres game. We picked this hotel due to its close location to PETCO park. The hotel has its own separate entrance way into the park so you dont have to fight crowds. Very Convenient! Service at the Omni was fabulous! Anything we needed, they were willing to try to get for us as well as help us out in any way with restaurants, directions, things to do, etc. Our flight did not leave until 10:00 PM and the hotel allowed us to stay and not check out until 6:00 PM which was so beneficial. We could have the entire day to explore and site see. When i decide to go back to San Diego, I will stay at this hotel again. I do not have one bad thing to say about this hotel. Book your stay here now. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: prissyshay
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Check in was super smooth and easy and i was able to check in at 9am on a weekday. Hotel staff was very welcoming and concierge pointed us towards our sightseeing journey. The room was very large and luxurious. We had a view of PETCO park. The bathroom was sooo roomy i loved that traveling with a family. No counter space to store toiletries but i just moved all their items on the shelves and used that. It was right in the beginning of the Gaslamp district and there were tons of restaurants and bars in walking distance. There is also a Mccormick restaurant in the hotel. We were there on a game night, and the atmosphere changed dramatically. It was full of traveling fans (you could tell when everyone in the elevator was wearing the opposing team's jerseys), baseball players who were being stopped for autographs and pictures and their families. In addition, the street in front of the hotel was closed for the game and droves of fans walked towards the hotel for the game. Nevertheless, it didnt bother us at all, we could hear a tiny bit of the game from the room but the bed was so comfy we were fast asleep. We had two snafus but they were quickly addressed. Some sort of water leak happened and there was no hot water in the hotel for about 2 hours at night...right at bath and bedtime...but they apologized worked on it and made a personal trip to the room armed with free bottled water to announce the arrival of the hot water. I thought that was very nice. Earlier in the evening we had received the most delicious cookies and milk complimentary for the kid...yeah i tasted it LOL! And upon arrival our child got an Omni fun backpack with toys that kept her busy in the room. They also had the option of borrowing a toy box full of toys for your stay. In addition we received the newspaper, 2 morning beverages and free wifi for being select guests. I couldnt imagine staying anywhere else in San Diego unless i wanted a beachfront hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: aspataro
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I decided to take a random trip to San Diego. I booked the hotel using Priceline and got a real good rate, about 50% off. Once we got the hotel we noticed that it was right next to the baseball stadium (Petco Park), and literally a few hundred yards from the Gaslamp district. This was perfect because we did most of our travels there. We did go to the beach one day but the traffic was pretty bad, and getting out of the hotel was annoying. Even though the hotel and rooms are very well presented, the rooms are a bit smaller than most 4 star hotels. I would say that if you were looking to hang out in downtown San Diego most of the time, and could afford $150-$200 a night, then this hotel would be a good choice. Otherwise, if you want to hit up the beaches for most of your travels, then maybe downtown San Diego isn't your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “The very definition of average”
Reviews.Author: PortoTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a stunning building from the outside, and the blandest thing ever once inside. There's nothing wrong with it, but it lacks personality, style, and sense of place. A banal business property, with poorly designed rooms, very disappointing given the stark contrast with the shiny architecture. Service is competent though, which is good thing in such a busy property. Definitely not my cup of tea, although reasonably priced. Would only recommend it to undemanding business customers looking for a safe place to crash with a swift laundry service, or for attendees at a conference on the other side of the street, you won't get any closer than this to the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: traveldamsel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty nice. It is expensive but it is nice. The rooms aren't anything to write home about but they are clean and have pretty good views. The front-desk staff and bellhops were very nice and helpful. The hotel is right next to the Gaslamp District and across the street from the convention center. It is also right next to a trolley stop but the sound of the bell couldn't be heard in the hotel so it didn't disrupt my sleep one bit. But it did allow us to catch the trolley to the harbor to go whale watching. The Hardrock Hotel is right across the street and is very loud with all the music playing but it could not be heard in the hotel. One weird thing about this hotel is that the bathroom door is a sliding door. I thought it was cool at first but then noticed that when closed there are gaps on either end of the door so if you are rooming with someone they would definitely be able to see into the bathroom. You also have to pay for the internet but if you sign up for their "club" you can get it for free. Just make sure to check your bill before you leave because although I signed up for the club I was charged for the internet. But, the people at the front desk were more than happy to remove the charge from my bill when I told them that I had signed up for their club. This hotel has a restaurant in it, which is expensive. If you like paying $16 for a bagel then you will be right at home in this restaurant. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, and I would definitely recommend it if you can get a great deal on a room. If you aren't planning on spending a lot of time in your room then it would be more cost effective to stay at a less expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful room in a friendly hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: itech425
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a convention and I would highly recommend it to anyone and definitely stay here again. I would also highly recommend enrolling in the omni select guest program on arrival. It's FREE and it allows two free beverages for 2 guests delivered to your room in the morning (the best coffee!) as well as a newspaper, free internet and they even upgraded us to a larger room. The hotel is so convenient to the gaslamp district, convention center, petco park and the transit system. It was an easy walk to everything. ALL of the staff are so freindly and helpful. The pool area and exercise rooms are unbelieveable and there is always fresh lemon water in the lobby and exercise room. My only regret is that I only stayed 5 days!

Reviews.Title: “Great service not matched by rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelMack425
Reviews.Content: Omni's service was extraordinary - both in attitude and response. Any time we needed something it was provided immediately and with a smile. The hotel's location is ideal - steps from the Gaslamp area and Petco Park with the harbor next door. With all this it's unlikely we'll go back. The room was small and inconvenient. There was no counter space in the bathrooms and little space beyond the bed. Closet space was also cramped. It is also loud outside and the windows shut did little to keep the noise out. This is unfortunate given the level of effort by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved the space, bathrooms and location”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline_sue
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 3 kids ages 11 -17. We booked a king suite connecting to a double room. We had lots of space and the bathrooms included a tiled shower and tub/shower. That really paid off when getting ready in the morning or for dinner. The first night our kids were impressed with the cookies and milk and we loved the morning drink service. The concierge was fantastic! He suggested a Segway tour that my husband loved and restaurants and directions. We did my husband's birthday dinner in the hotel restaurant and it was lovely. We walked every where and loved the location of the hotel. We thought the staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic home base”
Reviews.Author: blamar
Reviews.Content: We were staying at San Diego before our Holland America cruise left for the Mexican Riviera. After a $10 taxi ride we arrive at the Omni at about 8pm and all was ready for us. We immediately checked into our room. It was very clean and well appointed. We had a view on the city side and saw mostly across a parking structure and towards the Marriott hotel. We had a double bed room on the 13th floor; it was very comfortable. We had used Priceline to book the room. It was only the second time for us to use Priceline and it was not a problem at all. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and very nice. Aside from the lovely room and the pretty hotel, the other thing the Omni has something going for it is the location. It is right at the foot of the Gaslamp quarter. Nearby is a gateway to many wonderful restaurants. To the east, even connected to the hotel by a skybridge, is the beautiful Petco Park, home to the MLB San Diego Padres. We have to come back for a game. We had a full day of flying and now it was time for something to eat. We walked up the very busy street, past the bars, stores, and restaurants until we found one of our liking. We picked out the Marble Room, a former brothel, and had a great burger and beer. Another block or two up the hill and we found Ghirardelli Chocolate Company. The perfect desert. Another advantage of using the Omni as a home base is that it is adjacent to the MTS railway. We used daypasses for getting around town and out to Old San Diego. We found it was better to go to the San Diego Zoo via taxi although our passes would have taken us there for free. With all the walking you do in the zoo and Balboa park we opted for the cab. Make sure you apply for the Omni program as it will entitle you to free internet and breakfast coffee and juices. We even indulged in a breakfast bagel from room service. All was good. I took wonderful morning walks in the area. There is a Ralph's grocery store a few blocks away and the neighbourhood felt very safe. Walking along the harbour and along the sea side of the convention center was also very pretty and nice. In the evening we would have a nightcap drink at McCormick and Schmicks.which is part of the hotel. I would gladly return here. This is where many of the visiting baseball teams stay when they play in San Diego, as we were told by one of the bell hops. The roof top pool and hot tub on the sixth floor are very welcoming and warm, even in March. It would be great if they had a shuttle to the airport and about town but frankly taxi's cost the same for the two of us as a shuttle would. Also, on the Marriott side, it can be a little noisy on Friday and Saturday nights when the rooftop become party central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful hotel, & reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: cz4ever
Reviews.Content: I attended a weeklong business meeting at the Omni San Diego and was very pleasantly surprised by the venue. The hotel is in a great location along the edge of the Gaslamp District across from the Convention Center and the baseball stadium. The facilities and guest rooms were top notch, and the service was extremely friendly and attentive. I am a (not particularly active) member of the Omni Guest Select program, which added a lot of free amenities, e.g., wi-fi, two morning drinks (coffee + juice) delivered to the room, and several newspapers. If you are not a member, go ahead and sign up -- it's free and there is no minimum stay requirement.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot great location”
Reviews.Author: sanandreasfault
Reviews.Content: again - love the omni chain (see tucson omni review). this one is not as nice as tucson but still great. awesome staff. they went out of their way to welcome us. the place is right in the gas light area so u can eat, drink and stumble home.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location and not too pricey”
Reviews.Author: atlas750
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days and found the location to be perfect. The room was clean and comfortable and fairly large. The lobby restaurant was superior to most hotel offerings, and there were many more within a ver short walk. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, so-so cleaning, good room”
Reviews.Author: mfbh
Reviews.Content: Room was large with all the usual amenities and nice toiletries. The staff on the front desk and on the phone were very helpful at all times of the day as were the concierges. However, the room was haphazardly cleaned each day: waste bin wasn't emptied one day; towels weren't folded another; pyjamas were thrown on chair or on the second bed; ironing board wasn't put away; etc. Business centre was pricey to print and internet was $10 a day. Else an excellent stay in a well polished hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: SWJay
Reviews.Content: Rarely does a large chain hotel provide the kind of amenities and personal service that was provided by the Omni San Diego. We loved the location of the hotel and the view from our corner room. Walking to the Gaslight Quarter took only a few minutes and there was a really upscale Ralph's Supermarket nearby where we were able to purchase some items that we wanted for our cruise. The service was especially exemplary because of the chief concierge, Robert Marks, who was extremely helpful with all our questions. Interestingly, the concierge desk is located away from the hub of the reception desk area but it was certainly worth finding it and we loved the dish of cookies that were there for the taking. All in all a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: Hombresg33
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service. Above and beyond value! I found a great deal on their website, and chose to book here, instead of at another hotel - where my business conference was being held. I'm so glad I did. The room was clean, zen-like, and I wound up with a fantastic view of San Diego Bay, even though I booked one of the less expensive rooms. I was treated to two complementary beverages and a paper in the mornings. Also, due to my Omni perks membership, I had free wi-fi in my room. All in all, I'm very glad I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls in junior suite. Bathroom smelled like curry.”
Reviews.Author: admiraltwin
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful. The junior suite looked great, and I had an ocean view on the 18th floor. Nevertheless, my first night I wanted to get to sleep early and had to complain about the loud techno music coming from the room next door. It was taken care of nearly immediately. But the couple got their revenge at 2 a.m. when I was awakened to the sounds of mating and a headboard banging into our shared wall. In addition, the bathroom smelled like curry the whole week, and it grew stronger every day. Would I stay here again? Doubtful. Also, the business center charges about $6 a minute for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to San Diego we always work to stay at the Omni -- location and service make for a great stay. This time was no different. Room, service and location to Gaslamp District (awesome food -- Fields and Tivolie) are two places not to be missed. We were upgraded to a corner room and had a great view of the bay and surrounding area, Can't go wrong staying at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: lynnielein
Reviews.Content: 8 ladies celebrating my 50th stayed in ajoining rooms on the 20th floor. Upon entering the room, we stopped to check out the view....just fantastic, and an aircraft carrier coming into the harbor at that moment was spectacular. Rooms were classy, comfy, quiet. Very centrally located, just a few blocks from SD's top restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: bluehawaii2003HD
Reviews.Content: I tried the Omni because the regular hotel I stay at was booked. I have to say that I'm glad that I had to stay here! They staff, location and beds are great. I will say that to save money join their hotel club to save on internet cost $9.99 perday plus you get free USA Today during the week, nightly turn-down, morning drinks (coffee, juice or water) it's just good business.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are stars here”
Reviews.Author: UKtog
Reviews.Content: Pre cruise trip to San Diego, our first to this part of the world. It will not be our last and when we come back, it will be to the Omni From the minute I drove up, I was treated like their most important guest, though it was clear everyone was their most important guest. Jarelle, the loyalty amabassador had been absolutely excellent in answering pre cruise questions, Jeff who showed us to the room was so enthusiastic about San Diego and made sure we were setlled in well. We never left without people checking if we needed anything and did we need maps Jarelle's restaurant recommendation hit exactly the right spot. Yes there is a little noise, yes the train woke us at 4am (I am not sure why it has to sound its horn then, I think it is spite) but most downtown hotels are going to hear that sound. We were light sleeping anyway as we had jetlag so I guess we would have been waking anyway An absolutely first class experience and it shows, you can have a good hotel but it becomes 5 star, not because of the bling or the fittings but because of the enthusiasm and service commitment of the staff - well done Omni - (and if you look at out past reviews we do not give 5/5 that often

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: coxo66
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, rooms are nicely furnished, and the bed is comfortable. Great pool too. Perfect location for walking to bars etc. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I can't think of a thing they could have done better.”
Reviews.Author: TimoLV
Reviews.Content: The hotel and facilities are first class. I didn't want to leave after my 4 night stay. This hotel is in walking distance of many great restaurants and bars. The only thing that was a sore spot was the parking. Their valet was way too expensive. I recommend the parking garage just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: sv11146
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, in a great location. You are walking distance to the Gaslamp District (the Gaslamp Arch is 2 blocks away) and the Convention Center (on the other side of the trolly tracks). The trolly, which you can take to both Old Town, the Airport, Qualcomm, and SDSU, is right behind the hotel. There is also a walkway that connects the hotel to Petco Field! Very nice staff, and comfortable rooms. The bathroom is roomy, clean, and modern. The only potential issue (for women, not guys!!) is the lack of counter space....they have small shelves next to the sink, which were more than adequate for me. The upside for women is the bathroom is equipped with a portable hair dryer. The only downside to the room was that a number of the channels on the TV (not a flatscreen) were fuzzy. I would defintely stay here again, if the price was right (under $200/night).

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: jcm4
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the west coast and the Omni was exceptional. When we checked in Michelle made us feel like she had been waiting just for us. Eileen at concierge gave us recommendations in dining and destinations that hit the mark every time. The valet service was very fast and friendly and welcoming on our return. The rooms were some of the cleanest in any hotel I've ever stayed in. The Omni is a beautiful hotel and we would love to stay here again. Thanks for giving us a great impression of San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “we were not disappointed with our room/view on the 16th floor”
Reviews.Author: K_BZAK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Christmas period. The hotel is only new which was nice. We had requested a view and we were not disappointed with our room on the 16th floor!! We had great views across the harbour! Was right next to Petco park and the boys really enjoyed the tour they did there. Is also in the Gaslamp district which means we were never short of somewhere to eat!! The valet was a bit pricey, but they were happy to recommend a parking garage across the road which was cheaper. Only down side is that we had a visit from security on Christmas night as they had a complaint about the noise from our room. It was only 9.20pm and we were in the middle of calling our families home in Australia. The staff were really good about it though, at least they were following through with another customers complaint!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for convention center”
Reviews.Author: BandN129
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at the Omni, San Diego. Pretty much everything about this place has already been said in previous posts. Very convenient to the Convention Center, Gas Lamp Dist and anything you need is in walking distance. Staff very friendly - especially the doormen/valets (Luke). Beautiful, well appointed rooms kept immaculately clean every day. I had read on TA about the noise issue. Once I checked in I noticed I was on the 14th floor and didn't think this would be an issue. Unfortunately I STILL heard to partying from Hard Rock going on every night. Overall, very pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndell_f
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend you stay at Omni Hotel, San Diego! We had a great sized room, with a wonderful view. The beds were super comfortable, and were always made to perfection by the housekeepers. Concierge were very helpful in recommending things to do and booking tours. They have a great loyalty program which offers additional perks like free wi-fi and free morning beverages. Valet parking is available at a cost and there is also a self-park carpark close by which is a very reasonable price. The staff are super friendly and welcoming and you are located right near the highly popular Gaslamp Quarter! As an extra bonus, Omni is an environmentally friendly hotel too!! Stay here- you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Smasher1
Reviews.Content: This really is a different class of hotel. From the moment you pull in to the valet you are really well looked after. We were told very honestly that the parking rates over the road were cheaper than valet, but I still decided to go with the hotel parking. Little touches such as bottles of water in the car when you take it from the valet and great guides to the city (thanks David, such a nice bloke and told us about some great spots to visit in the city!) The room was so big and comfortable and the pool area was so relaxing. We also ate in the hotel one night, which we never do, but the service, food and drink was great. Really enjoyed our time at the hotel and it will be our first choice if we return. The surrounding Gas Lamp area is kicking and good fun with some great places eat! Thanks to all the staff a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazingly wonderful hotel staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjkingmd
Reviews.Content: The Omni in San Diego is a lovely hotel, with comfortable rooms, great amenities and an excellent location. There is round the clock room service, a very nice restaurant in the hotel, and reliable wifi which is free if you are a member of the loyalty program. I had a room with a beautiful view of the Bay and it was steps away from the Convention Center Sufficient reason to stay there in my opinion. BUT what really sets this hotel apart is the staff. These people are the most seriously friendly, hospitable and service-oriented hotel staff I have ever encountered! From the bellman to the front desk to the waiters in the restaurant and the engineer who fixed a minor problem with the A/C in my room quickly and cheerfully...the people who work here are wonderful. Imagine how sad I was when the airline cancelled my trip home and I was forced to spend another day here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joyluv
Reviews.Content: I love to travel. My stay at the Omni San Diego Hotel is in the top 5 of my hotel stays. The Hotel honored my request for a corner room. The view and balcony was great! I had many choices of hotels in the area and I am glad I chose the Omni. I would definetly stay here again if I am in San Diego. My only compaints are the old televisions and the train noise at night (which I believe the latter is beyond the hotels control).

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kimber_jewel
Reviews.Content: Location was prefect for my need. I was attending a conference at the convention center and it was a short 5 minute walk. Located right next to the gas lamp district there was plenty to do in the evenings. The trolley stops right in front of the hotel as well. Room was clean and modern. I had a view directly into the baseball stadium which was kinda neat. Staff was friendly through out the trip. Coffee shop was the only disappointment, one morning I ordered an iced mocha frappe and basically got a chocolate shake.

Reviews.Title: “Staff pleasant, accomodations satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: jeffofescondido
Reviews.Content: We checked in after using Hot wire to get a reduced rate. We parked overnight in the city owned parking on the corner of 4th and Tony Gywnn Way. There or no in and out privileges, but at $14 its very reasonable. So if you plan to just hang out downtown this beats the hotel overnight rate of $32 plus the customary tipping. The hotel is clean and the front desk staff well mannered and pleasant. Loaned us umbrellas for walking to Morton's Steak house, within walking distance. The room, is alright the bedding is the standard fair, however after being in heavenly bedding its a real step down. The TV was old school and there was all sorts of unnecessary electronics for games? DVD Player, keyboard, too much. Keep it simple stupid. The TV was fuzzy until and dropped my suitcase on the floor next to the TV and walla the picture screen went clear. Restroom was good size, but the towels were very standard. We were on the 20th floor which provided a good view of downtown and Petco Park. The kicker was night time noise, I have stayed here twice and forgot that the Hard Rock Hotel has a club which creates noise. Also the hallways seemed noisy. We were in 2016 which was right by the elevator, so that is the luck of the draw. Wi-Fi was $9.95, which seemed reasonable to me and pretty standard. I use my IPAD to stay in contact. Overall the value against the price was good, not great. limited dining choices in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff - noisy in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: AVisitor80126
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days on a holiday package - it was an excellent deal - included valet parking. The staff is awesome - maybe the best I have ever come across. Very friendly and knowledgable of the area, and some great ideas. Location is great right next to Gaslamp and Petco (in season). Went out of their way to assist a few times, when I know other places would have not been accomodating. But - the rooms are not well sound insulated. The Hard Rock across the street is LOUD, and even the provided ear plugs did not help. Could see light all around front door, so noise in the hallway was right in the room. The sliding door on the bathrooms is pretty dumb idea. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, but would ask to be on the other side of the hotel. Be sure to sign up for Preferred and get free internet and beverages in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: megcalve
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Omni's before, but this hotel really blew the rest out of the water. Our room had a fantastic view! It was very modern and zen like in the room and the bathroom.
