Not to mention that every night they got chocolate chip cookies and milk delivered to our room! They loved it and were excited every night when they were about to be delivered. The only downside was that our shower head in the bathroom was malfunctioning the first night, but after a quick call to the front desk, they promised to fix within the next 2 hours or give us another room. They were excellent to deal with and immediatlty got our showerhead fixed. This is an excellent choice whether going with your family or as a couple or with friends. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous downtown hotel with water view”
Reviews.Author: Love-to-wander-Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni the last 2 nights of our 5 night San Diego family vacation. I am so so glad we stayed here last. Otherwise I would have never got my kids to step foot in our other 2 hotels. I had picked each hotel based on the attractions we were going to that day. Thus while at Legoland I suggest you stay up north in Carlsbad; Mission Valley for the Zoo and La Jolla; and then move south to downtown while you tour Coronado and the downtown area. This Omni is only 4 years old and it looks brand new. It is modern without being weird or stark. The glass makes it open and airy and the large windows make the lobby and the hotel rooms feel so huge. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Their maps were better than any I found from AAA or online. I would suggest you pay the extra for the premium room with a view of the water. We were in #1906 and the view of the water was spectacular. Each morning I am normally anxious to grab a shower and hit the town, but here I wanted to sit and enjoy the view while lingering over my coffee, juice and paper (all free and delivered to your room each a.m. if you sign up for the Omni frequent guest program). But you do need food, so by 9:30 am we would head down to the restaurant on the 1st floor for the nice buffet. $13 for continental or $19 for cold & hot choices--beverages, lots of fruit, eggs cooked to order and all of the usual 4* restaurant choices. Buffet is open till 11 am. (What a great idea.) We recommend the bed and breakfast package that included $30 valet parking and a $40 coupon for breakfast each a.m. With a full tummy, we never needed lunch till 2 or 3 pm each day. Decor in the room is very nice. Yes, there is sliding bathroom door. No big deal. In fact I grew to like it since it meant no one ever hit me when I was in the bathroom and they decided they wanted to come in. Lots of fluffy towels, 2 waffle style robes and a neat way to use shelves to give you a lot of vanity counter space. Yes, there was a train about 2 am but you can roll over and go back to sleep or use the free earplugs provided in the nightstand if you are worried about it. Milk and cookies were included with our turndown services. Of course the kids loved that. They have a backpack of kids' games if you need them but we never did. The outdoor 6th floor pool is very unique and the jacuzzi was built by a parent because he understood you want to sit in there yet keep an eye on your kids 15 feet away in the pool. There are many restaurants in walking district. Just go 1 block over and you are in the Gaslamp district with block after block of choices. The red trolley line stops right outside the hotel so that is an easy way to see the city if you do not have a car. The Convention center is across the street. The Coronado Bridge is 5 minutes away. We drove over and parked about 2 blocks from the famous Hotel del Coronado. We walked on the sidewalk, went in "the Del" to look for the ghost of Kate Morgan (the Del's resident ghost) and then changed in their restrooms and hit the great beach right in front of The Del. Del's ice cream shop, coffee shop and bar were easy stops for refreshments. The U.S. Midway, all of the other Harbor activities and even Balboa Park are 5-15 minutes from the Omni. So do not think you can only stay at the Omni if you are downtown for business. It is well-suited for sight-seeing too. In conclusion: we were originally WOWed by the view, but we came to realize everything about the Omni is very very nice. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Omni -- Great Stay -- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend with my wife at the Omni San Diego – the accommodations for the hotel are excellent; the room was great (had a corner room –make sure you ask for one) and the service was outstanding. I did not eat at the hotel so can not comment here – the hotel location is Outstanding as it is right next to the Gaslamp District with lots of great restaurants and bars. Also, you are right next to the Trolley Stop and can get around town for $5.00 (all day pass) so no need to rent a car. If you do rent a car, valet at the hotel is $30.00 or you can park in the garage across the street for $20.00 overnight or $8.00 for the day. No need to rent a car if you plan to stay around the downtown area. You can even take the trolley into Mexico – you will need a car if you plan to go to Sea World. If you go to the Zoo, you can ride the trolley and take the bus to the Zoo from the stop by the community college. The $5.00 all-day ticket covers the trolley and bus. We would definitely stay at the Omni again and San Diego id a fun city with lots to see and do. We took the trolley to Old Town (walk-around the old city, a State Park to see what live was like back in the 1800’s – free); went out to Coronado Island (Hotel Del Mar) and ate at Miguel’s Cocina across from the hotel – was highly recommended and great food at a great price. We ate seafood at Ocean Air, was recommended by many (in Gaslamp) and Outstanding – not cheap but I’d recommend eating at the bar as the service is super, bar menu to choose from and no need to wait 1.5 hours for a table. Last night ate at Irish Pub (great music) in Gaslamp – did not have a bad experience anywhere. Overall, stay at the Omni – super stay, great location and close to restaurants and night life. Directly across the street from the Convention Center so if there is a big event then there will be lots of people around. But the city easily handles the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, I liked the property and had a comfortable stay. The room was moderately spacious, and the wall to wall window overlooking the bay offered a great view (19th floor). Comfortable beds, clean, in-room coffee. Soundproofing should have been a greater emphasis when the property was built. The train, trolley, boats in the bay are heard almost constantly, and I could hear the TV next door. Also, there is only one expensive restaurant on site and a very small convenience store, so plan on leaving the hotel for better dining options. The location is outstanding. Right on the bay, right across the street from the convention center, and the Gaslamp District is next door (lots of dining options, stores, etc). I 'd consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clinst
Reviews.Content: Very busy location, but fun! Many restaurant choices in the area, but hotel restaurant is a good choice. Front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: fiki7
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Omni over Christmas week. The hotel is located at the entrance to the gaslamp quarter with many shops and restaurants nearby. The rooms are modern and clean. I agree the sliding bathroom door is a bit odd. Staff was friendly, and service was excellent. Room service was good. I recommend joining the select guest program to get free internet, newspaper, and morning drinks. The fitness room is well equipped. Location of the hotel is very central; not far from the zoo, Seaworld, Coronado, and shopping (Horton Plaza a few blocks away, and many other malls a short drive away). I highly recommend the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: TooTexasTravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on our honeymoon to find that our room was a bit warm. One of the air conditioning units had gone out. We called the front desk and once it was determined that it could not be fixed quickly, A.J. was up to our room in minutes. He was kind enough to personally escort us to three very nice rooms and let us choose where we wanted to move. He then sent up a hand-written letter apologizing for any inconvenience and offered any further assistance that we may need. Alongside the card was an assortment of candy, coke, and popcorn, which we enjoyed that night. Another special touch was given by Adriana from Select Guest Services. We were initially greeted in our room with red wine, chocolates, and a handwritten congratulations card from her. It was a very thoughtful way of making sure our honeymoon started out perfect. The concierge service was also outstanding. We absolutely loved Elizabeth and all of the advice and help she gave us. She found us wonderful dining experiences and activities and was perfect on following up with us -- not too pushy, but not too lax. Memorable experiences such as "Ice Skating on the Beach" and the best golf I have ever played were made available only by her expertise. Overall, the service at restaurants and stores in San Diego were somewhat sub par, but walking into our hotel was a sigh of relief knowing that we would be treated like royalty! This was not just a vacation, rather it was the best experience that I have EVER had at any hotel in all of my travels. We will exclusively use Omni Hotels in all of our vacations from this point forward if there is one available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...some issues with the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: RickyAz
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at the Omni over Christmas with our 2 kids. Got a great rate that included free valet parking, through the Omni website. We had a well appointed room on a high floor overlooking the bay, with great sunset views. Room was spotlessly clean, comfortable and modern. I would stay there again without a second thought. We had only two complaints about the room. First, there seems to be a trend away from queen size beds. Two full beds is a little annoying and just a bit too cozy when there are two adults and two kids. But the Omni, like so many other hotels, only offers one king or two fulls. The second criticism of the room is the funky bathroom door. It looks very cool, but it doesn't offer much in the way of privacy. It is essentially a sliding barn door style, so it covers the main opening of the doorway, but leaves gaps open all the way around. My wife, in particular, was not very happy about that. We also had a pretty bad experience at McCormick & Schmick's, the restaurant located on the first floor of the hotel. Without getting into the details, they were understaffed and had not ordered sufficiently for the weekend, so they ran out of a lot of menu items early. The place was packed with unhappy diners, because the kitchen was so painfully slow. To their credit, the management handled things correctly. Ultimately, our entire meal was paid for by the restaurant. A few days later, the general manager called me personally to apologize and sent another $50 gift card to use the next time we're in San Diego. We'll probably take her up on it, on the assumption that they were just having a very bad night.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: DSCS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a break from the holiday hustle and bustle and spend a night in downtown San Diego. This was our first time at the Omni. We parked at the parking structure right across the hotel for $8/day. Check in was easy and the staff was very curtious (Skye). She gave us a room on the top floor with bay view....it was great value for $130 from the hotel Website. The noise didn't seem to be an issue since we only heard the train once about 11:00pm. Went to Blue Point for a romantic dinner and loved the food and the ambiance. In the morning after checking out, we took a nice walk taround Seaport village and had coffee and omlette at one of the little cafes there. Our favorite hotel downtown is still the Marriott Seaport Village, but we enjoyed our stay at Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LTKING
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni earlier this month on a business trip and it was so wonderful! The location can't be beat - directly across the street from the convention center and walking distance to so many restaurants in the gaslamp district. The hotel itself feels new and is very clean. The staff was so nice and friendly to us, day in and day out. The valet guys were very pleasant. My room faced the Coronado bridge and the view was great. The whole place has a very upscale feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: GregoryOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with fantastic views. I had a corner room on the 15th Floor with windows facing the Coronado Bridge, Coronado Island and Pt. Reyes. It is next to Petco Park (a baseball stadium) and right in the Gaslamp District. Short walking distance to a ton of restaurants. Back to the hotel: the room was very very nice with a wide screen tv, modern bathroom fixtures and a small balcony. The room was very quiet, I know this because there was a little construction outside and with the windows closed you could not hear a thing. I would love to come back during baseball season as you can walk up a ramp right into the newish stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel, bland and boring”
Reviews.Author: mangoplantation
Reviews.Content: Good location but really corporate, typical and boring. If you are looking for a business hotel, fine. But if you want something unique, charming and lovely, this is definitely not it. Look for something more fun, we found so many great little boutiques while walking along the beach. Don't let these reviews sway you. Its an ok joint, nothing worth writing home about.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with Omni”
Reviews.Author: SarahASeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni in October 2008 for a work conference. I was very impressed. I had a breathtaking view of the bay (room was on 17th floor) and the room was beautiful. It certainly didn’t feel like a traditional business hotel. The rooms had modern flair with a slide style door at the bathroom and a non traditional bathroom layout. Fairly good size room as well. The bed was very comfortable and the internet service was easy to get started and reliable. I would stay here again for work or personal travel. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. When I first checked in and went to my room, the keys they had given me didn’t work and I trudged back down with all my luggage anticipating a loooong 2 day stay, but they were incredibly apologetic and said if I had problems, I could call down from the phone near the elevator and they would send someone up. I didn’t eat at this hotel though am familiar with the restaurant chain that serves as their restaurant and it is good food in general. I also did not have time to partake in many things like the pool or hot tub, though the patio where the pool was seemed quite lovely to hang out on. Overall, I would say this was a great experience and hopefully I’ll return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but some caveats”
Reviews.Author: WSmile5
Reviews.Content: Great views, fine room. Our room on an upper floor faced the bay bridge and RR yards, so a bit of noise from trains, not too bad. Staff great, swell location for conferences or Padres. Stayed 2 nights. Only other problem is the bathroom has louvers into the room, so privacy is compromised. This is a weird design-thing about the room. We also stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp, which I'd give the edge to although it lacks a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: atlchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for a conference in October and was quite impressed with my stay. The location at the Gaslamp Quarter was spectacular, the lobby was clean and attractive and the rooms were also quite nice. A few things to mention. I registered for the Preferred Member Services, which is free, and a wonderful value. They noted my preferences and gave me a king room, with a crib already set up for my infant daughter, cookies and milk for my kids, and turndown service every night. Internet access was free as well as a choice of newspaper and two beverages to be delivered to the room every morning. I also took advantage of the online check in which is available up to 48 hours prior to check in. So when I arrived to the hotel, my keys were already available on a side shelf, similar to a rental car preferred member service. The room itself has enough room for a desk, chair an ottoman. Everything was clean and comfortable and my room, 1505, had great views of the bay and Coronado. The bathroom door is a little weird in that its shutters. It looks neat but if you're traveling with someone you're not extremely close to, it can be odd. Also the tub is very shallow. Breakfast at McCormick and Schmicks was delicious. I ordered room service for dinner one night which was good and delivered promptly. In addition there was a business service center with printer, internet access, etc. a coffee shop and ATM in the lobby area. A walkway connects the hotel to Petco Park. All in all, my family and I had a wonderful stay here. I only wish we were able to stay here for our entire visit to San Diego but unfortunately the weekend rates ($295) were a bit much for us and we gambled with Priceline and got the Hotel Solamar. While a decent hotel, I would've much preferred the Omni and think it is worth the price. While it is not Four Seasons or the Ritz, it is quite the comfortable stay with awesome customer service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bethr111
Reviews.Content: Great service, nicely furnished room and great location makes Omni hotel on of the best hotels in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Another (mostly) great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: mrswh
Reviews.Content: My family (me, husband, children ages 2 and 4) stayed at the Omni for 3 nights at the end of September. It was our second stay at the hotel and the second was just as good as the first. The other reviews have already covered the important things - great location, great service, terrific housekeeping, clean, large rooms, nice toiletries, etc. Housekeeping gets a special mention from me - we asked that our rooms be cleaned each day during a 3 hour window, which they did. They do a fantastic job, and turndown service is also very nice. McCormick & Schmicks was super - great service, good food. The breakfast buffet is very nice. Valet & bell service was prompt and friendly. We had rooms 1912 and 1913, overlooking the convention center, bay and Coronado. Beautiful view. Yes, there can be noise outside - the train, planes on final approach into SAN, etc. It didn't really bother me much. If you are sensitive to noise, don't stay downtown at all, as you are likely to get airplane noise anywhere downtown due to the location of the airport. (On the plus side, such an easy drive from the airport!) My only complaint about the hotel is the billing, and it is the reason I did not give the hotel 5 stars. We visited the hotel in September 2007 and at that time we were overcharged in two different ways. (Charged for valet parking even though it was included in package, charged for "complimentary" room upgrade at check-in). Last year, I brought it to the attention of management, and was assured it was not typical and would not happen again. Precisely the same billing error occurred this year. It is apparent that there is a glitch in the computer system and/or poor training of employees, and I find it annoying that I have to pick over the bill with a fine tooth comb and then spend 15 minutes straightening out their errors, particularly when I have already brought those errors to their attention a year before. A great hotel, but watch your bill!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but the Train WOOOOOO WOOOOO”
Reviews.Author: Geordies_Travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 4 days at the Omni Hotel in San Diego. I really liked the hotel, the staff were great, the pool is really nice. However I cannot believe no one has mentioned in their reviews the trains. Every morning (4am ish) except one we were woken up by the train leaving the huge marshalling yards just behind the hotel. It would pull up outside the Hotel where the lights were on red and blow it's horn about 5 or 6 times. I know I am a light sleeper but you could hear it 4 blocks away. It was annoying but not the end of the world just thought I should mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent staff and service, CAN'T BEAT THE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: JoeBruin1
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk were very welcoming. Very warm and professional. Our room had a nice view of the bay and the Coronado Bridge. The bed was really comfortable and the furnishings were really nice. Both the room and the bathroom were designed with great care. The gym had a good number of machines and work out equipment. Unlike other hotel gyms that were included as an after-thought, the Omni hotel gym was open and did not feel cramped. The pool was nice and felt like a roof top pool. My suggestion is to get there early since it gets crowded at times and chairs might be in short supply. Service at the hotel was excellent. We needed access to a freezer and the hotel staff was more than happy to accommodate. The hotel is located at the west end of the Gaslamp district. It is walking distance to great bars and good places to eat. There is no lack of choices for restaurants and shopping. It also has access to Petco stadium. If you do not need in and out privileges and you can efficiently plan your day, I would suggest parking at the structure in front of the hotel. Valet parking costs $30/day, the structure is $10. Overall great hotel, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service. This is THE PLACE to stay in Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Shakers_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked a double room for our first time visit to San Diego and not only did it not disappoint, it proved to be simply WONDERFUL. The location of the hotel cannot be beat - on the doorstep of the Gaslamp Quarter and all the action, seconds from the Convention Center, and minutes from the colorful Seaport village. You can reach everywhere on foot - dinning, shopping, and sightseeing. It is a very lively and safe neighborhood. On our arrival, we were greeted by very friendly and courteous staff, our really spacious and spotless clean room was ready on our arrival and what a VIEW. My mother and brother were staying at another hotel in Diego and once we compared their hotel with ours, we immediately decided to have them move in with us at the Omni. The hotel made sure that we got an equally nice room - despite the very short notice - and my mother and brother were given a room on the same floor as us, and with an equally magnificent view of the bay and the bridge. Service is impeccable, the staff extremely friendly and the room and the spacious bathroom equipped with all the amenities you can think of. I have to mention here two people who were exceptionally efficient and courteous: Ms. Elizabeth Marking and Ms. Kelly Craig both of whom went way beyond the call of duty to help on two separate problems that we were facing. They could not have done more and my family and I cannot be more appreciative. Would I stay there again? Is there anywhere else to stay?! There is no doubt in my mind that the lovely hotel experience we had contributed to our enjoyment of the visit and this charming city. Would I recommend this hotel to others? Definitely and I already have. Whether you are in Diego for business or lesiure, honestly, look no further if you want the best location and the best service.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Experience”
Reviews.Author: nalcala
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! That is the best part of this hotel. If you are a baseball fan and want to watch a game at PETCO park, the fourth floor of the hotel leads to a bridge that connects to the park, only allowing hotel guests to pass in and out of. Gaslamp quarter is right around the corner along with a lot of restaurants, which is much needed. Omni, as far as I can see, only has McCormick & Schmick and the poolside bar food available for guests. I did not see a room service menu in the room. If you are looking to party, this is not the place for you. The bar at Mc & S closes at 11:30pm daily. However, there are many hotels around with clubs, bars, lounges to visit. The Omni caters to more older people as opposed to the party crowd on Saturday night. That was fine by us, my fiance and myself. We like to go out, have fun and come home to peace & quiet. The rooms were definately quiet. I couldn't even hear the trains/metros pass by every five minutes like you do when you are on the street. The room was comfortable. I you're not used to feather pillows definatley bring your own. Valet costs $30.00 daily (not included in your room rate). This is very reasonable considering other parkades charge about 18.00 everytime you park. If you do the express checkout, which is very handy, don't forget to leave your minibar key, believe me they will charge you to replace the key. All of the staff was very friendly and always asked if we needed directions. My fiance left two dress shirts in the closet by accident and I, being pessimistic, thought they would be lifted by sticky fingers, like at other hotels. I called, got transferred to the housekeeping dept (lost and found) and they had the shirts and are Fed Ex-ing them as I type this. Overall, a very good experience. My only negative issue is the lack of restaurants. This could also be a tactic to keep party folks out as well. Few meal recommendations: Mary Jane had decent breakfasts. Lou and Mickey's was very tasty. I had the Salmon. Everything was a la carte. The hostess recommended a bottle of red wine, a Meritage called The Prisioner from Napa, $70.00. Very robust and smooth with a great nose. Go to Fred's vs. Rockin' Baja. Make a desert trip to Ghiardelli for a brownie sundae. Makes you think you're in San Francisco. I love seafood but didn't feel Mc & S was worth a second visit. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amzing Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: UKcouple08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon and had an amazing time. Excellent location. Pool great. Staff were brilliant and brought us complimentry champagne and strawberries as well as putting us in a king suite looking over San Diego Bay. Would highly reccomend this hotel - worth paying that bit extra for.

Reviews.Title: “A good time”
Reviews.Author: NeilMacUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights until the Sunday on Labor Day Weekend. Really enjoyed the stay here, excellent location for the gaslamp quarter and there are a number of excellent restaurants all within a very short walking distance. Had no problems with the valet parking when either dropping off or collecting our car, and better still we went for the Sweetheart package which included the valet parking and a lower than normal rate for the room. The only thing that let them down was the room service for breakfast, where they seemed incapable of delivering it at the time they promised over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Different experience compared to others”
Reviews.Author: kmats808
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous reviews, I thought we had gotten a great hotel for a good deal. We stayed over Labor Day weekend and had just stayed at the Omni LA, where the service and staff were excellent so we had been expecting the same experience. However that wasn't so. The day we checked in, we asked the concierge if there were any restaurants that had fast service as we had wanted to go to Sea World at night to experience their Summer Nights promotion. However, the concierge didn't even know that they were open until 11 because she told us "you might want to save your money because it's quite expensive and they close soon." This was about 6:30 p.m. i would think that a concierge would know what time major attractions open and close. After I told her that it was open until 11, to answer my question regarding a place with fast service, she suggested a place next to the hotel that we had eaten at upon our arrival earlier that day. When we told her this, she said that she didn't know any other locations and wished us "good luck." We ended up spending an extra 20-25 minutes walking around the Gaslamp District trying to find a place. With the many restaurants, I would think that there are some that provide fast service and something a concierge would have knowledge about. I guess we expected too much from a concierge after receiving such excellent service at the Omni LA. The valet was also quite slow at times. Upon returning for the evening one night, we were the only car that pulled in. I was in the car for about a minute gathering our items and the attendant didn't even come to the car even though we could clearly see him standing at the valet door doing nothing. Even after we got out of the car, it took a while for him to come over to get our keys. Again, I guess we expected too much after receiving such great service up in LA. We did let the manager know about these experiences and she did give us complimentary buffets, but it's hard to recover when these experiences were the initial experiences with the hotel. It was truly a letdown after reading all the rave reviews on here. The room was decent; nothing spectacular. The door to the bathroom was a sliding one that didn't even cover the whole door frame so there wasn't full closure; don't know who came up with that design. I guess that was better than having the rooms with the shutters. Compared to the Omni LA, Omni San Diego was definitely a let down. I guess for the price we got, it was a good deal, but I would definitely wouldn't pay anything above that ($99/night).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: fratlord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni over Labor Day weekend. Service was great, everyone was helpful and friendly. Parking was $30 a day, but I never have a problem paying for a convenience like that. The room was great, well decorated and we had a small balcony. There were sliding glass doors that lead to a balcony that was about a foot deep. But, it provided for an excellent view of the bay, it also overlooked the pool and terrace. We actually watched a wedding on terrace Sunday afternoon. I would definitely suggest requesting one of these rooms as I know rooms on the other sides do not have balcony's at all. The hotel was in an even better location than we had expected. Obviously right next to Petco Park, which was fun. But also, just a block from the Gaslamp district. We spent a lot of time on 5th street, mostly eating! We would definitely stay there again if we visit Sand Diego. Oh yes, the fish place next door was awesome, the tacos are great, I had the calamari.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: MisEE
Reviews.Content: This hotel was magnificent. We drove in to San Diego in the afternoon, and were promptly attended to by the hotel valets. Parking is $30, but it is comparable to any lot in the area. Check in was also speedy, and we received great service despite the fact that we booked on Priceline, and the fact that we were only staying one night. The room was wonderful - very clean, very modern, and was of an adequate size. The bathroom was also very clean, which is always important to me. The pool area was also quite impressive, and was a great place to lounge away the afternoon. The pool itself is not large, but the ambience is great - the pool is on the 6th or 7th floor, so feels somewhat like a "rooftop" pool. It is very busy, and may be difficult to find lounge chairs. However, there is enough room that you could just roll out a towel and lie on the concrete as some guests did until chairs opened up. Location was very central, right in the Gaslamp Quarter. As it was a Friday night, it was quite busy and happening. Great place to be if you are looking for great places to drink and meet people. There is also a multitude of restaurants nearby - Nobu was just around the corner. Overall, I was very impressed and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter360
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 night at the omni from jun 30-jul 5 and loved it. we had a corner room and through one window we could see the padres games in petco park and through the other we could see downtown san diego. we got a great rate of $97/ night on priceline. i guess they make it up in parking at $30 a day, but you dont have much of a choice, the city parking in a pain because you have to pay $15 everytime you enter so if you dont want to come and go a lot then its for you. The first few nights it was nice and empty i had the pool (which was great but only 3 feet deep throughout)to my self the weight room, but then for the fourth of July weekend lots of people came and it was hard to get a spot by the pool. It is with in walking distence to all of the gaslamp which is one of the greatest downtowns of any major city great food, entertainment, and night life, though i was not allowed in to all of the clubs. I would return again with out hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sacka
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to all the reviews I have seen on Trip Advisor.The room was comfortable,the staff helpful,and the location is the best.The concierge at the hotel,Connie,was especially helpful and gave us first class treatment.I cannot say enough good things about her and our stay at the hotel.She made my birthday very special.

Reviews.Title: “Very good (if not fully functional)”
Reviews.Author: Reuel_Tidhar
Reviews.Content: I was at the Omni for a committee meeting of an organization I serve, and stayed in a suite. The hotel is modern, well kept and clean, everything looks like new. There is a rather popular pool (though it was closed for half a day for a private function). The in-hotel restaurant and room service were very good. The only drawback was the lack of a working space area. No place to sit down in the room with a laptop and a few documents and do some work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandcris
Reviews.Content: My wife, 16 year old son & I stayed here from July 29 to Aug 2, 2008 via Priceline. We were received by an extremely friendly front desk staff who put us in a corner room on the 11th floor overlooking Petco Park. We were there for the beach AND a Friday night game at Petco, so having the stadium just outside our window (although we were not high enough to see into the field) it was still exciting. The hotel is 4 star from head to tail. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable, etc. etc. etc. I suggest joining the Select Guest program, which gave us free internet service and free coffee and juice delivered to our room each morning ( a very nice perk!) The pool on the 6th floor is wonderful and popular with guests. I like to workout each morning and the exercise room here was far above average. First, there is no additional cost (hello Hilton, take a note on that.) The equipment was in great shape and the spare towels and fruit were a nice touch. The location is on the edge of the Gas Lamp District, which is busy, hopping and full of vitality each night. There are dozens and dozens of restaurants within walking distance (although I have to recommend the happy hour at McCormick and Schmick which is adjacent to the lobby.....where else can you get a full cheeseburger and fries for $1.99 or two fish tacos or a few other items before and after the baseball game?) The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The only downside is parking. The valet parking is $30.00 per day. Ouch!!!! The lot across the street is cheaper, but it does not allow in and out privileges, so for us the convenience of getting the car whenever we wanted won out over trying to save money. Also, be aware that they steam clean the stadium after each game all night, so it is noisy being on that side of the hotel. Overall, we had a great experience and would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel All Around”
Reviews.Author: mrolfes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We booked online, not thru the hotel. We looked for a couple hours to get exactly what we wanted, good location, 2 queen beds, a balcony and a decent price. The website we were using said the Omni had all the requirements. When we arrived at the Omni we were told the website was wrong and that the room we wanted did not have a balcony. They said they had been trying to get the website to change the info, but they had not yet. Without having to make a fuss the Omni gave us keys to different suites they had available and told us to choose which one we wanted. The suite we picked was amazing. It had a double outdoor patio, huge wonderful bathroom, big living room area, great beds and the best of all a very large wonderful wet bar area. We will book this room again, 635. I know it will never be at the same price we paid, but it would be worth it. The patio was huge. It was part of the open terrace area and pool. It was sectioned off with planters, so you had some privacy but could also see what else was going on. I don't know how they did this, but the rooms were also very quiet once you shut the doors. The location is perfect. You are steps away from Gaslight and across from Petco Park and many other attractions. The room and hotel were amazing, but I have to say the best part of all was the customer service. They went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. We didn't have to want for anything. When we chose our room, the front desk sent up someone to our room, instead of making us come down to get keys and give cc info. We ordered room service and after 45 min of waiting, we called to double check on the order. They apoligized and told us it was on the house. Even at check out, which they let us check out at 3pm, every staff member was so friendly and nice asking us how our stay was. If you can't tell, I can not say enough about this hotel, I just loved my stay and can't wait to go back. It was really hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeAway
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Location couldn't be better. Right next to the Petco Ballpark- literally! An escalator in the hotel leads right to the ballpark. The Omni is also located a block from the Gaslamp Quarter (restaurants, shops, bars galore)! The staff at the hotel is wonderful...always greeting you with a friendly smile and willing to give advice on where to go and what to do! The hotel rooms are very modern & clean, the gym is equipped with everything you need, and the pool is a great way to relax!. The trolley is a block from the Omni and is great to get around to other areas of town.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BRGuest
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the OMNI SD and it was just as good as the first. I love this hotel. The main reason is that it's hands down the best service a hotel can ever have. The staff is fantastic!!! They will cater to your every need. The beds are super comfy. The turndown service is great. I would recommend signing up for the select guest program at no charge and you get beverage's every morning outside your door and very reasonble breakfast items at low prices. This is the only place I will stay in San Diego. FYI all the other OMNI hotels are just as fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “4th of July at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiluv
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on Priceline, and were pleased to win the Omni at $112.00 per night for two nights. Our room and experience was very much like other reviews written here on the same weekend.We watched the fireworks right from our balcony on 4th of July! Our room, standard King, over looked the pool on the 7th floor. We enjoyed people watching of the beautiful people and the babies and kids in the pool itself. We rarely interacted with the staff except a snack & cocktails from room service which was prompt. The room service food was good however the cocktails (Mai Tai's) were horrible and non edible($18.00 for both). We didn't complain and just left them on the desk to be cleaned with the room. We had a semi stocked mini bar, as there were two empty bottles of Grey Goose bottles, that had the caps replaced and put back in their perspective places. I called down to the front desk to advise them and they said it happens all the time, and they will not charge our room which they didn't. There were other empty spots leading one to believe other items had not been replaced as well. The Valet was prompt all weekend except the day we checked out, we stood their with our bags in hand for a good 6-7 minutes and no Valet staff every asked us if we needed help. Finally my husband muscled the bags over to the Valet desk where two young gentleman were chatting close by and asked for someone to get our car. Not the best for $30.00 a day I thought. Nothing special about the Valet either for the price, unlike the Four Seasons or The Ritz where you get bottled water, direction basically anything & everything you can think of and things you don't think of. The reasons we continue to visit those chains over and over again. This was a very pretty hotel and had lots of nice amentities. Had we paid the hotel website rates, I would have been a little miffed on the size of the room and the lack of privacy the bathroom does not offer. It truly does bring a couple closer than you may want to be!!!! My husband was nice enough to fetch coffee when it was my turn to shower (: so I could have some privacy. We would stay here again but only via Priceline, if I was going to pay top price I would look elsewhere. There are sooo many choices in this beautiful city. We spent the final two nights of our trip at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay, see review.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: MillionMilr
Reviews.Content: I stayed the Omni San Diego with my family around July 4th weekend and a fabulous stay. For starters, I was able to secure a very decent rate that included complimentary valet parking and a $40 per day breakfast credit (room service or the restaurant). We arrived at the hotel with our 2 boys (ages 2 and 4). The Omni has a Kids Program where they give each child an Omni backback filled with a kids cup, gummy worms, toys, and lots of other stuff. Pretty cool!!! My kids thoroughly enjoyed this. Also, they get complimentary milk and cookies delivered to their room every night. The staff went out of their way to make us and our kids feel at home. The first day we arrived, we ended up arriving extremely early and ate breakfast at the restaurant. I have to highlight the great service of the food & beverage manager - Fernando Rodriquez who really gave us great advice on where to go in San Diego, and went out of his way to make my kids feel welcome. Fernando is awesome!!!!! He was so polite each day he saw us around the hotel. The front desk staff is also very friendly. We arrived early and they promptly checked us in to an upgraded room on - Corner Harbor View on a high floor. We had a great view of the Coronado Bay Bridge. I recommend you ask for a bay view room. We were able to see fireworks from our window on July 4th. The staff also made sure we had a roll-away bed for our kids as well as a microwave and fridge to store their milk and other food items. My favorite service of this hotel is their complimentary morning coffee/tea service delivered straight to your room at a time of your choosing. Basically, you leave a card outside your door and mark the drinks you want - coffee/tea/juice/bottled water, etc, along with the time you want the delivery. They will either bring it inside your room, or knock and leave outside your door. I loved getting fresh coffee delivered to the room each morning...complmentary!!! This my second stay at an Omni property and its fast becoming my favorite hotel chain. I would equate it to a Four Seasons quality service without all the pretention and price. In fact, the entire hotel staff was friendly. It is a well run property where there is great consistency in service throughout the hotel. If you like sushi, this hotel is next door to a Nobu restaurant (we were soo surprised, since we LOVE Nobu!!!). It's also across from the Gaslap Trolly station which you can take all around town. Very convenient. There is also a Ralph's grocery store which is a few blocks away. My only complaint with this location is that it is next door to a rail yard. On my first night, I did head the blaring horns of some long distance cargo trains. But, I didn't hear any on the following nights. Overall, this was a great stay!!! Way to go Omni San Diego!!!!!! I can't wait for my return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Jubley”
Reviews.Author: Teddep
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Omni for 3 nights (Jul 4-7th) and had a great time. I had requested and booked 2 adjoining non smoking rooms (one for my teenage children) which were available for us on arrival. The rooms are decorated very tastefully and the bathroom was bright (needs a towel rail). No fridge available to cool your own things down but there was an ice machine on the floor. We were on the 4th floor with views over the pool and stadium. We could not hear from either the pool or passing trains. My only gripe was the sliding door to the on-suite bathroom. I don't want to go into the details but needless to say it's not very sound proof and there is no fan. This is one of those, it looks great but functions awfully, a design flaw. The pool area was very clean and there were plenty of towels. Parking was $30 per day (plus tip) which I thought was a bit high but as a non local it was difficult to know where else to park. As the hotel is right in the Gas Lamp district you can do without the car for evening meals etc If you do go, join up to the Omni's frequent visitor program and you get a free hot/cold drink and newspaper brought to your room each morning. It's free to join and is a great way to start the day We had breakfast in the hotel once, staff were excellent but the buffet looked a bit dry. We went for fresh cooked which was great The real asset for the Omni is their staff, every interaction is positive and friendly. My kids were brought cookies and milk each evening and the house keeper would hide chocolates for them in their room, it made the stay fun. We had a great time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissCappy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Omni San Diego for two nights (July 5-7). I was lucky enough to book my reservations through Hotwire and the total for two nights was about $350. There really isn't anything I can negatively about the hotel. The location is perfect, in the Gaslamp Quarter (very very clean area of downtown SD) and is adjacent to Petco Park, right next to trolley access, great food, clubs, shops within walking distance. It is also right across the street from the Hard Rock and Marriot. The restaurant in the lobby, McCormicks, is excellent as well as the bar. All of the staff was extremely helpful and attentive. The rooms are nice and clean, not super big but they are comfortable. The valet parking is $30 but there is a parking garage directly across the street that is very resonabley priced. I think overnight we only paid $8. All and all I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to others. I will have to say that it was mostly older folks and families staying there, witch we didn't mind, but if you are looking for somewhere with a bit younger crowd then I'd suggest Hard Rock and the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Homerun Package”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying this is my third stay at the Omni San Diego, once in 2004, once in 2006 and now this year. Each visit has been part of a Homerun package meaning just one night in the hotel. Not a fair way to rate a hotel in my estimation. That said I have to admit I was less "wowed" this time than two years ago. We were four couple attending the $299.00 Homerun package which consisted of one night in the hotel, two Padres tickets, two breakfasts the next morning in McCormick's & Schmitt's, cracker jacks and a bag of peanuts in your room and free valeting parking (a $25.00 value). Not too far off the price this package was in 2004 when without valet parking thrown in we paid $179.00 (but Petco Park had just opened as had the adjacent hotel which was running a special to get bookings). Service was exceptional at check-in. Three couples were allowed to go to their rooms at 2:00 pm, my room was delayed "up to 30 minutes." They called in 15 minutes. When I went to obtain the room key I couldn't help but notice the line. So while we had flown through check-in fifteen minutes earlier, not everyone was so lucky trying to check in closer to the normal arrival time of 3:00 pm. Two of us were provided with an extra freebie, "two beers, two brauts" from the pool bar or the restaurant. Since it wasn't part of the package I asked the gal as the front desk about it when I went to pick up my room key. There was no explanation about the inequity but to her credit she immediately got the assistant restaurant manager to add one "two beers, two brauts" onto the back of his business card for one of the couples. Very classy and very much appreciated. Three of us received the "cracker jacks and peanuts" in our room right after check in (although pretzels were substituted in two cases, chex mix in the other for the peanuts) and the fourth couple had to call to get what was intended as a cute buy in to the baseball theme. It seems they were unprepared delivering on their own reservations. Not the right product (who eats pretzels at a ball game! :)) and they had forgotten one of us. Two couples went to the pool. There was only one server bringing drinks. The prices weren't too bad. Three beers, two mojitos and a margarita only set up back $39.00. But the server had added a second margarita which was annoying...and it took quite a few minutes to get it corrected before we felt comfortable returning to the room. Now I am just belly-aching but I was aware that the first year we purchased this package the baseball tickets were on a lower level and very near the catwalk that takes you from the third floor of the hotel into Petco Park. This year we were ten rows from the top of the stadium albeit nearly directly behind home plate. The Padres are not doing well in the standings so I am not sure what to attribute the decline in the quality of tickets. I love this hotel. I like the rooms. I like the beds. I like being able to open my window over the pool to listen to the singer crooning out the oldies in the middle of the day. This package gives you just the standard room. I expect for a little more they have some really nice features. But most of all I like the package. I didn't like getting my room charges under the door in the morning and seeing a second $40.00 pool charge on there. Again to their credit they promptly removed it as I was checking out but again I say...you are a four-star hotel, this shouldn't happen. One couple tried to leave at 6:00 am for another commitment they had. Valet gave them the bad news the lights had been left on and the battery was dead. One of the valets had to jump the car with his own truck when AAA had not shown up within 30 minutes. There is just no excuse for that. And predictably (I should know better) all the large change (quarters, dimes) had been removed from my loose change pile I keep in my ash tray. I have heard the philosophical argument that valet guys think you won't miss it, feel entitled to take it, etc., etc., etc. I call it theft and am constantly annoyed that it happens. Fortunately the GPS that my wife had put in the glove box was still there so I guess I should say thanks for small favors. Great location at the base of the Gaslamp district. Handy to just about anything you want to do in downtown San Diego. Still a beautiful, generally good-service hotel after four years. But watch out for those valet guys!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Omni Stay”
Reviews.Author: GingerGirlNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni on our way to Hawaii and found it a great center location, near the convention center and ballpark. It was quiet, personnel was helpful, room was spotless and we really enjoyed our two-day stay! They recommended a great breakfast spot, Cafe 222 (awesome breakfast!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: khigg
Reviews.Content: The Omni was great! We got a corner room on the 17th floor facing the Petco Stadium and the Gaslamp District. The view of the stadium was so spectacular that it inspired us to go see the Padres play the Mets! The beds were comfy and clean. I was only woken up by a train once on the first night. The staff was very helpful and accomodating whenever needed. The elevators were quick! The pool is beautiful and thoroughly enjoyed a beverage while soaking up the CA sun!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martin1982
Reviews.Content: stayed at the omni for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. we booked a standard room , but when we arrived we were told we were being placed in the penthouse suite as it was our honeymoon!!! The room was huge with two 42 inch lcd tv`s! it had a huge lounge, 2 bathrooms and a kitchen with beautiful views of the bay! The pool area was very nice and relaxing and all the staff were great. Excellent location to shopping and restaurants. Would stay here again if in san diego. Only down side would be the train noise, but if you have a high level room then it will not bother you as much.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Continues To Delight Us”
Reviews.Author: K2A2
Reviews.Content: The downtown San Diego Omni is so pleasant, all the way down to the courteous doormen to the attractive lobby to the lighted paintings in the hallways. I loved having the Starbucks built into the gift shop downstairs --that way we were not forced to utilize sit-down restaurants or room service for breakfast. My little girls still want more of those sumptuous chocolate mints from the nightly turndown service. Reasonably priced self-parking was conveniently located very close across the street. Bathrooms were a comfortable size, stocked with wonderful shower amenities. Exercise room and pool were beautiful (open till 10 P.M.). If you love to walk, the trendy Gaslamp District is just yards away. Seaport Village and Horton Plaza are not too far either. Can't beat this hotel if you are seeking a special experience in a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Just a short stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: bitirish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni from May 25-May 27.. just a short trip after a 15 day cruise... the Omni was fantastic.. great service.. nice rooms. They sent us a small bottle of champagne, a rose and some chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary.. My son got cookies and milk every night.. We stayed in room 2033 and it was directly over the stadium.. which they had a game the day we arrived.. it was great. My son got in the pool a bit the night before we left.. it was to cold for me, but he said the pool was warm. The hotel is convenient to the gaslamp district and a short distance to the seavillage... we walked almost everywhere. The parking for valet was $30 a night... But in every big city you pay something for parking. We did use the car on the second day, so I think it was worth the $30 to drive in and out without worrying. All and all I think it was a great hotel, nice people, clean.. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bluiCSR
Reviews.Content: This place is beautifully elegant from the decor to its location. We went to a Padres game, and the bridge linking this hotel to Petco Field is very convenient. First class all the way!!!! The only negative thing about this hotel is the noise from the commercial trains that blow their horns in the very early morning hours of the day, i.e. 1:00- 7:00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Service rules in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference in the city. They made a great recovery from a bad start. Arrived after long and tiring flight from UK at 10pm to be told that despite my pre request they did not have a no smoking room available ( cannot believe the US still allows smoking in hotel rooms !) but that the assigned room had been 'specially ventilated and prepared'. Went up to the room and nearly gagged as a determined cigar smoker had obviously been staying for some time inb the past - could not consider sleeping here and made that clear - eventually a non smoking room - albeit on a lower floor with a crap view became available. Rooms are a good size - noise insulation is good and was unaware of my neighbours in a packed hotel . AC worked well during an unseasonal hot spell and free wireless available. Location is great near to waterfront / gaslight district and the conference centre. Didn't notice the train noise myself- despite the comments posted by others. Only had breakfast in the Mccormack and Schmidts restaurant - was fine - not amazing but OK. The hotel was really busy during a major conference and the staff did their best - but were stressed. Overall - recommend especially if you get a good deal - if you want plush and spoiling though you may be better off else where.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: bigfol
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Omni before getting on a cruise ship. Great location, friendly staff, modern and clean room, and since we booked through Priceline - and unbeatable price. The two common complaints about the hotel are noise and the bathroom door. In terms of noise we were on the 9th floor facing the street, so we weren't on the side with the trolley. We could hear the trolley, but it wasn't anything that kept us up. As for complaints about noise from the Hard Rock - we stayed on a Friday night, after a baseball game, and we could scarcely hear a thing. The bathroom door is a sliding door that doesn't seal completely. So you don't have privacy issues, but there may not be as much of a noise barrier as some might like. No fan either. So yeah, if you're the shy type, turn on the tv before going in to do your business. Tin Fish next door is great for fish tacos and beer before the game (or even whenever), and a fantastic breakfast can be had at the Mission on J St. and 13th (10 minute walk). Finally - even if you book through Priceline you can still take advantage of their free wireless offer by signing up at their website.

Reviews.Title: “Omni a la Outsource”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: Hmmm...odd.... Pros: location, location, location (literally across the street from convention center)...main meeting point in lobby & bar for everyone at convention; clean & modern rooms; standard/expected omni expectations fulfilled, i.e., modern, clean rooms, delicious and prompt room service Cons: no spa - they need to "order in" a massage therapist for you (hint....go to lowes spa - it is off the beaten path on coronado so you can get a last minute appointment even during the height of conventions season). Odered room service at 9:15 pm - wanted some hot chocolate with my bagel. The outsourced hot chocolate vendor closed at 9 so no hot chocolate for me. What??!! Odd..strange... still...location and cleanliness outweigh my "cons". i would def stay here again for next convention. Candid traveler photos posted here are completely accurate and not from me. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice way to end our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Fijalclarkski
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, my wife and I decided to stay in downtown San Diego the night before our flight home. We arrived at the Omni around 1 AM (we called ahead to let them know we'd be late). Check-in was a relatively long process, but the man at the desk was very nice. We were placed on the 15th floor overlooking the harbor and pool - a beautiful view day or night. The room was beautifully decorated with wood and earth tones. The bed was very comfortable (just what we needed!). We only had a few hours in the morning before our flight, so we went to breakfast downstairs at McCormick & Schmick's (we had eaten there earlier in the week for dinner, which was excellent, but the breakfast was nothing special - not bad, just not memorable). We then went straight to the pool on the 6th floor. The shadow of the building was on the pool until around 9:30 AM, but it didn't matter, because the pool is heated - to bathwater temperature! It was actually a bit too warm for me to cool off in, but I'm from a cold climate. The pool was a beautiful place to spend our last few hours in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “too noisy”
Reviews.Author: cambsdad
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable enough but the noise from the trains was a real problem. Their whistles can blow at any time of day or night and you need to be pretty high to avoid them. I would have checked out if I had not been on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service”
Reviews.Author: JJH3d
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Rooms and service are outstanding. As previous posters said, be sure to register for free on line as an Omni Select Guest for free morning beverage room service (and free drinks all day for kids). Location is great – only two blocks to 5th Ave. and all of the Gaslamp restaurants. This is the best place to stay for seeing a Padres game as there is a bridge connecting the hotel to the stadium. I was there with my wife and two boys ages 9 and 7 and we went to a game one night. Be sure to walk through floors 4, 5 and 6 to view the hotel's version of a baseball museum. Really great. Minor complaints: $30 overnight parking is a bit steep for a downtown that is virtually empty 24/7. It appears that no one works downtown, so many streets need only a 4 way stop sign and no traffic light. Very strange. Also, the 6th floor roof pool is not heated and chilly. (Frick’s April 9th review mentions a heated pool but I believe that she is mistaken or the heater was broken during my visit).

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Fuzby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a meeting at the Convention Center, which is just across the trolley tracks. My roomate and I were significantly happier with our hotel than colleagues who stayed at the Center-attached Marriott. The room was attractive and we had a nice view of the harbor. The bathroom was a bit unusual, with a pedestal sink instead of a counter, and a set of multiple shelves on each side. This was a great setup for 2 people to share (lots of room for personal stuff), and freed up more floor space than in typical hotel bathrooms. There were robes provided that were smaller and less bulky than often found - they had pink trim, so if the better proportions reflected that 2 women had reserved the room, I'm really impressed! A major advantage for us was the free wireless internet - a good, fast connection. Elevators were speedy and desk staff friendly. Amenities were nice. The only minor negatives were too-thin pillows - and the room was on the pricy side, even at "special convention rates". But the location was excellent for our convention and exploring the Gaslamp Quarter, as well as the harbor area, and it was overall a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Is The Best Hotel I've Been In!”
Reviews.Author: jon17lyn
Reviews.Content: I am a san diegan and I needed to get away from the everyday life, so my boyfriend and I booked through Priceline, and because of this got an excellent deal! Our room was on the 19th floor, great view of the bay and the coronado bridge! SO FRESH AND SO ROMANTIC. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The beds were so comfortable and relaxing I wanted to take it home. We did everything at the hotel from eating at McCormick to getting in the Jaccuzzi and the fitness room. We stayed 2 nights and three days at the Omni. My favorite was the sewing kit that was provided because my blouse had a loose thread and I was able to fix it right away! I love the robes you are supplied with and the shower head was heavenly! Clean and spacious! Turn down service so quick and efficient. Overall our room was so romantic with the view and so comfortable. You are even given free coffee and access to great channels and cd player! The only thing would be parking. They only have the option of valet parking which was 30 dollars a night, but also you could park accross the street that ended up costing us about 20 dollars to park all 2 nights. OMNI IS AN EASY WALK AND ACCESS TO THE GREATEST PART OF DOWNTOWN! GASLAMP!! You'll think your in a whole different city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first visit to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Frick
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotel in San Diego was the perfect place for our first visit to San Diego. I booked the room through the hotel's website and since I am a preferred guest (it's free), I even received a phone call prior to our visit asking if I had any special requests. I did request a high floor, away from the train tracks, since I had read about the noise in previous Trip Advisor reviews. That request was granted. When we arrived at 3 p.m., our room was ready and check-in was efficient. We received a welcome card from the manager and a certificate for breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, McCormick and Schmick's. After we returned from dinner at Seaport Village (a beautiful 20 min. walk from hotel), turn-down service was complete, with mints, a rose and the next day's weather forecast. Our room (2033) had a great view of Petco Stadium and that evening, the Padres were playing the Dodgers, so it was exciting to see some of the game. With the window cracked, we could hear quite well and feel as if we were in the grandstands. The window that looked down at the stadium even had a window seat. The room was spacious and the bed was heavenly. Amenities were nice, even supplying coffee "to go" (paper) mugs and a nicely appointed honors bar. Bathroom amenities included shampoo, conditioner, lotion, mouthwash, a sewing kit, and of couse, soap. We did eat breakfast at the hotel since we had the certificate, but it was pricey. We each ordered a cup of coffee at $4+ a cup. My waffle was around $11 and my husband's french toast was about the same. It was good (came with cute, individual bottles of syrup), but if you are on a budget, might be best to opt for Morsel's, a coffee shop on the other end of the hotel's lobby. Speaking of the lobby, it was beautiful. The 6th floor heated pool had comfy lounge chairs with cushions and a nice supply of white, plush towels. Very nice. We only stayed at the Omni one night as we rented a car (from Enterprise -- great service) and headed north up the coast. If you're visiting San Diego, and particularly going to a baseball game, I recommend the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: cutenose
Reviews.Content: Execellent hotel with friendly staff. Great location eventhough it was a little noisy as there are bars nearby. Eventhough we stayed on the 8th floor, we were still able to hear the live band till wee hours of the morning. Very near to the train station and downtown. Hotel parking is quite expensive and there is a public parking just right beside the hotel. No credit card accepted at the public parking!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Porperty with a great location”
Reviews.Author: PGA2
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business trip. I found the room very comfortable. The hotel was well situated to the Gas Light District and the Convention Center. You could basically walk everywhere or use city trams that were beside the hotel. I would stay here again and strongly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Patience paid off - Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shadow1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for any baseball fans out there. I made our reservation about 3 months prior through The Omni's web site. I requested a room on a high floor with a view over looking the stadium. That's exactly what we got. This trip was planned so we could see the Angels play the Padres for an exhibition game. 2 Days prior to our arrival, The Omni sent me an e-mail that enabled us to check in through our computer at home. I went ahead and checked in this way but, I was a little worried this might hinder my chances with getting the room we wanted. Additionally, the on-line check in told me I'd be able to check in at 2 p.m. and no waiting in line. Check in time was supposed to at 3 p.m. according to the web site. We arrived shortly before 2. A little side note, we took took the Amtrak from San Juan Capistrano to Downtown San Diego. Thought we'd try the train this time. No problems with Amtrak. We walked about 8 or 9 blocks from the train station to The Omni. Downtown San Diego has got to be one of the nicest downtown areas in the states. Over the past several years the city has done a great job revitalizing the Gas Lamp District. Oh yeah, we stopped at a place called Dick's Last Resort for lunch. The food was just okay. I'm not sure if I'd eat there again. Arrived at the Omni and went to the check in desk. The young people working the counter were very nice and professional. The girl who helped me told me our room was not ready and asked if we would mind waiting. I didn't mind at all because she said our room was located exactly where I requested. Had to wait almost an hour for it to be ready. The wait was a little bit of a downer but, it was well worth it. While waiting, I saw one of my favorite players from the Angels, Rob Quinlan, in the lobby. I think some of the players stayed at the Omni. I ran into the Angels owner Arte Moreno at the game. He was nice enough to shake my hand and smile. Back to the details with the room. We had room #1833 on the 18th floor. Check out my photos. It was a standard room, about 400 sq. ft. The only weird thing about the room was the bathroom door. The door was on a hanging track and slid to open and close. It didn't really give much privacy. People are able to hear you do your business. My suggestion, turn on the water, so nobody can hear you. I'd read many complaints from others here regarding the trains and the trolley. This is one of the reasons I wanted to be on the stadium side of the hotel. There is still some noise on this side of the building. It really didn't bother us though. Ask the hotel for some extra pillows and sleep with a pillow over your head. This helped me. I heard one train horn at 3 a.m., that was the only time I was bothered. Overall, I give our experience 4 out of 5 stars. Will we stay there again? Absolutely. I'm already thinking about another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: unknown_to_nyc
Reviews.Content: Just came back from SD. We stayed at the Omni for 4 nights, we loved it!! I got a rate of $109 per night through travelzoo.com, which is the same rate I paid for a night at Ramada in Carlsbad. I requested a room on the higher floor, I got 18th, facing the bay and the train track. I could hear a bit of noise early in the morning but it didn't bother me since I woke up early every morning anyway. I registered on line on their web site as a "selected guest" (it is free), and upon checked in, my son received a back pack with toys and cooky & candies, also a Omni kid's cup with unlimited drink refill in their restaurant for the entire stay. As a "selected guest", I also received 2 servings of beverages of my choice every morning, same as my son & my husband. Even though they don't have complimentary breakfast like others do, I had 2 glasses of V8 juices every morning and that really filled my up! Besides that, my son had 2 big cookies and a glass of milk every evening.......isn't it great?? The room is very clean and comfortable, it even has a DVD player that my son could play his favorite movie that he didn't finish on the plane. The only compliant is the bathroom doesn't have any exhaust fan. The hotel is at a great location. The trolley station is right by. We only rent a car for 2 days to go to Legoland, La Jolla & the Zoo. The rest of the time we took the trolley. We purchased a 2 day pass ($9) and have unlimited rides on the trolley to the surrounding Downtown attractions. There is a public covered parking lot right across the street. The daily rate is $8 and evening rate is $3. Fri & Sat is a few bucks more. There are many restaurants to choose along the Gaslamp Quarter area. SD is a great place to visit, and Omni just make it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Concierge....”
Reviews.Author: wickerparkmark
Reviews.Content: While I must admit, the hotel is a four star and conveniently located in the downtown, I had such a disgusting experience with the concierge that I am writing my first hotel review ever. My wife and I are "foodies" and we wanted a fantastic dinner in San Diego. We asked the concierge for the best sushi and/or fish restaurant in town, and he enthusiastically made reservations for us at a closeby restaurant (Oceanview), telling us that it had recently gotten a Zagat's 26 food rating. He told us he would try to get reservations, as it was popular on a Saturday night. He called the restaurant and made sure to give his own name....hmmm...I wonder why. We went to the restaurant, it was 90% empty on a Saturday night and the food was sub-par. Out of curiosity, I asked the manager of the restaurant what their Zagat rating was and was told...they have never been rated. Why would the concierge lie to us and push us to go to this particular restaurant, spend $150 dollars on a terrible dinner, and make sure the restaurant credited him with the reservation? I wonder.... If you don't like noise, you should also think twice about this hotel. We asked for a room on a top floor (got 15th) given other warnings about the noise, and even being that high didn't help. The 5th street scene is pretty darn low-class and loud ... until the wee hours of the morning. I'm sure the hotel is fine for business travelers during the week, or weekend party-goers...but proceed with caution if you want a good night sleep on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for medical conference Feb 2008. Agree with other travelers about rail car noise. On the 18th floor it wasn't a problem. Nice room. Lovely outdoor pool on 6th floor. No fridge in room which was a problem for us since we need some freezy packs twice daily to keep medication cool. As a result, we had to go to front desk to ask them to place these in one of their freezers and retrieve fresh frozen ones. Conference food excellent. Convenience to Gaslight District 100%. Bell staff great. Classy limo to the airport for flat $20 was excellent. Conference room rate $235. Wouldn't want to pay any more. Day pass on trolley excellent value. Trolley station outside hotel door. Handy for San Ysidro (and walk over border to Tijuana) and outlet plaza on CA side. Also, with transfer (inclusive with day pass) to bus, it takes you to Balboa Park and museums. One needs a car in San Diego. For next visit to San Diego, we'd probably stay somewhere else, rent a car, park near the hotel for conference, all for less than the daily room rate at The Omni. Just our personal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: MaxandLola
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention and have no complaints. One of the better business hotels I've stayed at and would highly recommend the Omni if you are going to the Convention Center. The bay view room had a balcony that extended out a foot or so. The room was clean, had good linens, comfortable bed, nice size modern bathrooms, and turn down service. Food ordered to the room was delivered when promised and was nicely done. The louvers between the bathroom and bedroom could be annoying for sharing the room because the bathroom light filtered into the bedroom. I didn't have a problem with it --just seemed like poor design and a bit of a dust collector. You do hear an occasional freight train go by-- the tracks are very close. The room with the bay views will probably give you the most train noise, but the views made up for the noise. I've stayed at the Marriott which is also very close to the Convention Center, but I prefer the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Hoooo Hooooo - Is that a TRAIN in my room ??!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JSMass
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this brief - since this is all that matters - YOU WILL NEVER GET A GOOD NIGHTS SLEEP HERE !!! Why - the damn train - at 3:30 AM nightly. The hotel will not be kind enough to share this -and why should they - No one would stay! The property is beautiful, staff is excellent, food was fantastic (gym sucked) - just you can't sleep - ugh !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean”
Reviews.Author: smsteffy
Reviews.Content: The Omni is conveniently located. I fund the room very clean and the staff very pleasant. Not my favorite 4 stars hotel in San Diego but nonetheless very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: lucidlilies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new in San Diego and it's right in the action of the Gaslamp and across the street from the Convention Center. If you are planning to stay at the Omni b/c of business (ie. tradeshow at the Convention Center) ask to get a room on the bayside on a higher floor (above 15th floor). Due to the location of the hotel, one side faces the bay/convention center and the other side faces the Gaslamp/ballpark. Here are the issues with both: Facing the bayside - I've heard this is very quiet if you are on a high floor. If you are not on a high floor (below approx 15th floor) you end up getting major tooting from the trolly/train that passes right in front of the hotel. People staying in higher floors don't appear to hear it as much. Facing the Gaslamp - This faces right into the Hard Rock Hotel which has an awesome, very trendy, 4th floor bar/club. The catch - the bar is all OUTSIDE so if it's Friday or Saturday, you are sure to have the music so loud that your room in the Omni will start to rumble. Very fun when you are on business and trying to get some sleep at midnight. It's so loud that I don't think a high floor is going to help. Then the real fun starts when the bars let out at 2am and people are screaming outside.... Overall fantastic hotel, beautifully appointed beds and bathrooms. Very clean and modern with great amenities. The bar downstairs has a great happy hour menu with good drinks. If you are vacationing, this is a great hotel for you as it's close to the Gaslamp, Seaport Village, shopping, etc. If you are on business, I'd consider the Hilton or Marriot which is still very close to the convention center (the Hilton is actually slightly closer than the Omni, but not by much) and you will not have a room that faces the dreaded Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids and Convention Goers...”
