Reviews.Author: Luvthesun
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a first-rate hotel. We stayed there with a toddler and they were so accommodating. Brought him milk and BIG cookies each night and folded his blankie and straightened the toys we had brought, when they cleaned up the room. Note... there is a small playground on the grounds of Petco Park. It is open most days sunrise to sunset and closes 4.5 hrs. before a game on game day. Great place for the kidos to play away some of that energy. We would definately stay here again. We stayed on the 18th floor on the bay side, had a spectacular view of the Bay and the mountains, and never heard any train noise. I do see the point of the sliding leuvered bathroom doors. It wasn't a big deal for our family and was actually convenient when my husband was at his convention but if I was sharing a room, it would be quite uncomfortable. Pool was wonderfully warm for this time of year. The DVD in the room came in handy as well. We felt as if the staff was clearly here for us. Can't say enough wonderful things!!!

Reviews.Title: “Omni was Great!”
Reviews.Author: ruchelaya
Reviews.Content: We were there with 4 children over Christmas - hotel was not fully booked. We had 3 rooms (got an incredible price through Expedia just 1-2 weeks before the trip!) and all of them were terrific - clean, great beds, good views, good ventilation, etc. The bathrooms are modern and clean, and the location of the hotel can't be beat. Even though we have all those kids - ! - they treated us extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “good option in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: doorstomanual
Reviews.Content: One night stay for business in early Dec. Had not stayed there before (previously in the G Hyatt or at Valencia in La Jolla - great place, by the way), but room was good size and well thought out. Clearly a great baseball location, but only suggestion I would make is (and this repeats comments below) concerns room location ... When I checked in I asked for a harbour view, thinking it would be a good option. In reality, from the hotel you don't see much harbour - more convention centre (and I was on a higher floor) than sea. Plus - and quite a big one - a main rail track runs right outside the hotel. I thought it looked quite quiet, but then a massive train came through v slowly and hooting - hence not quiet at all + other smaller trains frequent as well + hooting as they approached a crossing in front of the hotel. Hence, for light sleepers or with children, maybe better to be in a non-harbour room. Aside from that, all fine and front desk staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: ld1244
Reviews.Content: Fabulous upscale hotel downtown San Diego. Close to everything. Beautiful room, excellent view. Got a $99 dollar rate for a $300 room thru priceline. Two faults: Very expensive parking. A bit too close to a noisy train track.

Reviews.Title: “Poor design, many goofs---disappointing visit”
Reviews.Author: Grek
Reviews.Content: I've loved Omnis in other cities, so happily booked 4 nights in a suite at the San Diego Omni for my husband, myself, and our 5 year old son. Nothing about this hotel--except a handful of helpful staff--really seemed up to the standards I've experienced elsewhere. THE ROOM Our Junior Suite was certainly large enough (520 sf), but it wasn't designed with travelers in mind; it's the equivalent of a hotel McMansion--space but no useability. Want to unpack for a few days? Good luck--no dressers, no drawers. Maybe just want to keep things in your luggage? No dice there either--no suitcase stand. We ended up stashing clothes on every available shelf including bedside tables and the TV stand. There's a huge bedroom, but no closet in it, and only one chair. So strange. The couch folds out into a bed, but in order to unfold it, you need to move an extremely heavy round glass table (I couldn't move it alone) and a side chair. Not a typical arrangement at all. The bathroom is enormous (with a good shower!), but almost unusable. The pedestal sink with tiny shelves (about 6" x 4", full of towels) mean there is nowhere to put a toiletry bag, makeup, etc. Also, no towel bar, and exactly one robe hook, located--I counted, eight steps--across the very large room from the shower and bath. So, I guess you should leave it in a heap on the floor? Who on earth designed this mess? THE HOTEL Attractive, modern lobby. Oddly laid out (are we sensing a theme here?) The concierge desk is waaaaaaaay over in the corner where you'd never find it without signs and directions. McCormick's and Schmick's restaurant is very good. Room service was great, fast, typically expensive. The menu seemed especially limited, though. THE SERVICE Uneven. Big compliments to the bell staff and the concierge. All were full of helpful suggestions and anticipated our needs. The front desk and housekeeping staff--not so much. Read on. . THE LITTLE PROBLEMS As a Select Guest, I've been treated very well at other Omnis. Here I was denied an upgrade (even though I had a valid voucher) because of availability, though the hotel was absolutely deserted for the time we were there (Jan 1-4, trust me, no one was in downtown San Diego the weekdays after a holiday). The OmniKids rolling backpack of activities never arrived. The bedtime milk and cookies arrived twice in one night, not at all another. Morning coffee/juice was twice left outside the door with no knock, so I eventually discovered the tray much later (and colder). Sometimes there was service for two, sometimes for three. Turndown time varied wildly from 5:30 to 9:00. At other hotels, they seem to aim for a more consistent (and convenient) 7-8 o'clock. We arranged for late checkout (rare rainy day in SD meant we had a few hours to kill and couldn't really walk around in the cold drizzle), but then had FOUR separate housekeeping staff knock on the door as we packed. None of these incidents, individually, was a Major Problem, but in aggregate they made for a stay that was consistently full of small annoyances and not what I expect from a purported five star hotel. Some dining suggestions--be advised it's far from the heart of the Gaslamp district and downtown. Nearby, eat at Mary Jane's Diner at the nearby Hard Rock (casual). Dussini Mediterranian Bistro a few blocks away was lovely for dinner (upscale). In sum: This hotel may be fine for game night or a convention, but don't go here with a family or for luxury. The suites are so poorly designed as to be a waste of the extra money--maybe the standard rooms are better. Other Omnis do a great job, but not this one. I trust Trip Advisor ratings, but in this case they're deceiving--Look hard at hotels that are more centrally located and more thoughtfully designed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pullthetab
Reviews.Content: The Omni in San Diego was fantastic (unlike the Omni in Phila - old, dark and dusty). The service was exceptional, the rooms reasonably spacious and immaculately clean, the restaurant delicious with some of the best waiters/waitresses I have encountered (although expensive for dinner), and the rest of the facilities great. The view is fantastic, overlooking the water. It is right next to the Gaslamp district (lots of shops and restaurants) and the trolley. The only minor downsides are 1) No indoor pool, 2) strange system for valet parking in which every time you valet park, they have to go through the whole routine of getting your name and room number and writing it down, giving you a new ticket (instead of giving you 1 ticket for the entire stay), and 3) the lobby is a bit simple and small (not the grand lobbies in many of the hotels nearby). However, these are all truly minor flaws in a near flawless hotel. They do accept pets, a plus for pet owners (although if you have allergies, not sure if they have pet free rooms - they never brought it up nor did I). A few of the rooms on each floor have balconies (ask specifically if you want one). Overall, wonderful experience which will bring me back to them when I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ammenities, but join free "Select Guest" club before booking”
Reviews.Author: chicago2socal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located adjacent to Petco Park where the San Diego baseball team plays. The hotel has a baseball theme and is a perfect stay during the season. The Omni has a direct access ramp leading to the baseball park with a guest only private room with snacks for guests attending a game. Here's a tip: Join their "Select Guest" program (its free online). You will get nice ammenities and discount coupons during your stay. For being a Select Guest, I was given free room service breakfast item coupons for each morning of my stay. Each morning the breakfast was waiting for me at the door with a free gift like suntan lotion. This was very impressive! I also received 50% off coupons for a future stay. Another tip: The hotel has a McCormick & Schmick's that serves an excellent happy hour menu of $2.00 items in the bar. The hotel is fairly new and nicely located by the convention center and Gaslamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get the "premium" room”
Reviews.Author: spunky2637
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, but they really talk up the premium rooms which cost a lot more. There is no view of the bay because it is blocked by the convention center. Plus, the premium rooms have the joy of facing the train station so you get to hear horns blaring all night and day. Insist on the cheaper "deluxe" room. The fitness room and the pool are pretty small. I was disappointed with that. The rooms are average for what you are paying. It's clean and what you would expect for the price, but nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a visit to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: curiousjayu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Omni for two nights, before taking a cruise to San Diego. The staff were friendly and courteous and the location is excellent. As the other reviews indicate, the hotel is at the foot of the Gaslamp District and walkable to shopping, restaurants, etc. The room was clean and in very good condition with some nice amenities. My only complaint is that the room itself was a bit small. The hotel also has a small but good gym which we used during our stay. All that said, we booked this on priceline for $105/night -- for two nights, with taxes, it came to around $240, which was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Algood
Reviews.Content: This is a real nice hotel in a fabulous location. Everything is walking distance. The rooms are spacious and nice. If you are planning to park there, think again as valet parking is $24 a night. Just around the corner there is a garage much cheaper (from 6p.m until 3 a.m. $8.00 - then a dollar for every hour). The harbor is a real nice place to walk and look at all the activity - but not walking distance. There is a real nice break fast place called Cafe 222 walking distance to the hotel. They even have McCormick & Schmicks on the ground floor. If you are there on weekdays, happy hour is enticing ! Overall, we found this hotel really nice and the staff pleasant .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: FleegeFamily
Reviews.Content: I wish I could've stayed more than one night, so that I could spend more time in the room. I found this to be one of the more uniquely appointed rooms I've seen in a while; very soothing and pleasing to the eye. The hotel is in a very convenient location. The staff was pleasant, but I didn't find anyone to be particularly informative on the questions I posed. Being the self-proclaimed coffee connoussier that I am, I can't help but judge everywhere I go by their coffee. I had a mean Americano from the little shop in the lobby. Woo hoo, Omni San Diego! I plan on staying here the next time I'm in town for pleasure; hopefully to see a Padres game.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KittyCat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Omni for going on three years now during the holidays. San Diego is my hometown, and when we visit my family, coming to the Omni is truly like coming home. For the price, you can't beat the value. I've read some of the other reviews, and can't understand why anyone would pay $28 for valet parking when you can park across a narrow street from the hotel in a covered garage for $8 a day. Love the free wi-fi and the view is spectacular. For visitors who are not satisfied with the information provided by the Omni staff about the area, I would encourage you to visit (--) either during your visit (using the hotel's free wi-fi) or beforehand. It's a great site and has plenty of information, including a link to the Trolley's website, (--), which is very easy to understand and plan a trip. Three cheers for the Omni - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Coporate/Generic/Just OK”
Reviews.Author: jsjsjsjs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the week of Thanksgiving 2007. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but only a few of them could provide us with useful knowledge about the downtown San Diego area (shops, restaurants, etc.). The rooms are nice, but nothing distinctive. They're somewhat small, especially the bathrooms that have absolutely no counter space. The room cleanliness was below average, as we noticed a stained easy chair and hair on the bathroom floors. Given the location and the price we paid, we expected a more impressive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not as nice as many omnis”
Reviews.Author: serenityseekerFL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent conference and was very pleased by the location. The room was good, but it had not been upkept very well. By no means was it run down, but it was not worth the $248/night that I paid. Breakfast room service was quite good, but pricey...lunch and dinner room service was not particularly good. There was a nice pool and jacuzzi with fresh towels available at the facility. It is right on the trolley line and at the entrance to the gaslamp. I probably would not stay here again if given the choice, likely choosing the Hard Rock that is right across the street from the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: smitty195
Reviews.Content: I can't say much more that hasn't already been said. I stayed here for 3 nights in November, 2007 and I'm writing this review from my room at the Omni on my last night here. The hotel is very nice. As was stated previously, the valet parking is extremely expensive---$28 per 24 hour period. But the valet parking garage is in the exact same building as the regular parking, and it's across the street. What does this mean? Simple---park the car yourself and save a ton of money! When I say "across the street", it's not a huge city street. The street is the size of a small alley, so the walk is very minimal. If you are made of money, sure, go ahead and use valet. But if you're like most people, just park the car yourself and walk 30 seconds to the hotel's front door. I only have two gripes, and both are very minor: 1) The staff doesn't seem to know much about the San Diego Trolley system (the Trolley is San Diego's light rail system). Also, the website for the San Diego Trolley is very poorly laid out and is confusing. For example, PETCO park is not listed on the Trolley maps, and the Omni is located next to PETCO park. Trying to figure out how to get from the hotel to ANYWHERE on the Trolley system is very confusing!!! I assumed the Omni staff downstairs at the front would be able to tell me about the Trolley system--ANYTHING about it---but they could not do this. Three front desk clerks, the gentleman who opens the front door, four Valet employees, and the Concierge..... none of these people were informed about the San Diego Trolley. Unbelievable. For those who are interested in the Trolley, the closest Trolley station to the Omni is the "Gaslamp" station. However, this Trolley does not run into Old Town--it requires a transfer. If you have no disabilities and are able to walk okay, all you do is walk out the front door of the hotel, turn right, walk to the right around PETCO park, and start looking for the big clock tower. At the foot of the clock tower is the Trolley station called "12th and Imperial". This is about a 7 minute walk, walking at a normal and comfortable speed. If you look at the San Diego Trolley website, this station looks very confusing. Why they make something simple look so complex is incredibly stupid. Even though it looks like two different stations at "12th and Imperial", there is only one station there. To get to Old Town, you get on a BLUE Trolley. It really is as simple as that. 2) The hotel did not honor my request for a non-connecting room. This is very minor, so I don't want to make a big deal out of it. I was actually upgraded to a "junior suite", but it was a connecting room. I actually would have preferred a normal room that did not connect. But they put me into room 1820 which was very nice, but I could also hear every sniffle, every sneeze, and every phone call of my neighbor in the next room. Why do hotels have SO MANY connecting rooms? Do people actually request this type of room on a regular basis? I don't know anyone who has ever requested such a room. As I said earlier, those two gripes are very minor and would absolutely NOT prevent me from staying here again. Everything here is wonderful. The turn-down service is wonderful also. In addition to turning down the bed, they turn on classical music, put mint-chocolates on the bed, and a card with hand-written information for tomorrow's forecast. If you are an Omni Select Guest member, they also put a door-card on your bed so that you can choose your morning beverages and newspaper (a free service). One small comment.....a lot of folks have made comments about the odd bathroom door and the shutters between the bathroom and the bedroom. I have to agree here. Although I am traveling alone on this trip, I think it would be weird to have more than one person in the room when using the bathroom. There is no "sound-proofing" at all. Closing the door is just to block the view---it does not block the sound at all. And as someone else noted in another review, there is no fan in the bathroom. So you can get a mental picture on your own---no sound blocking and no fan. What were the designers thinking?????? I am looking forward to my next trip to San Diego so that I can stay at this hotel again! Minor gripes aside, it's an extremely nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilson17
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the hotel. The conference was over subscribed with 500 people, but the hotel's conference space was perfectly able to seat and efficiently deliver multiple meals that were unusually good for conference food. The hotel itself was excellent in essentially all respects. Great gas lamp district location, efficient friendly check-in, clean spacious room with nice view, comfortable bed, well equipped bathroom, free high quality wifi everywhere (although they did charge $3 for receiving a Fed Ex). I have always loved the San Diego Marriott, but it now has serious competition!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: previse
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, beautiful hotel, nice view, large attractive room. There was never a wait at the reception desk, everyone on the staff greeted us, held doors open, and couldn’t have been more helpful. Check in was instantaneous, checkout automatic, and checkout time isn’t until noon, which for us was a big convenience. The Omni is across the street from the convention center and just around the corner from an assortment of good restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yinkers
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at this hotel, very close to the gas lamp district and the convention centre and also the Padres ball park. Our room was on the top floor and from our window we could see into the ball field, fantastic view of the city. The room was very comfortable, with great bathroom, robes and toiletries. We had a great stay. The staff were wonderful. McCormicks, fish restaurant was great...waiting staff were wonderful and had great knowledge of the fish/food they served there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location - Go Padres”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGuitar
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Hotel in a Great City. The Omni is located at the end of the Gaslamp District, right next to the Padres Stadium and across the Street from the Convention Center and Marina. Everything listed is in easy walking distance so you won't use the car. Parking at the hotel is expensive but there is a public garage across the street that is half the cost. The Omni is fairly new so everything is clean and fresh. We never ate at the hotel because there are so many dining options right outside the door. There are many condos in the neighborhood, so there is a local vibe. Staying here made us experience a San Diego Urban Lifestyle while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but Nice”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after hearing about how great this hotel was. My wife and I booked a room for two nights on Priceline at a fraction of the list rate. That wasa good deal. Upon arrival we were greeted and made to feel welcome. The room was spartan, very clean but on the 8th floor facing the Gaslamp area. This resulted in a lot of noise from partiers and music from the bars, So much noise we did not get a good nights sleep. The walls were thin , a crying baby kept us up as well. So we requested a room change, whichthe hotel honored. 20th floor facing the Coronado bridge was much nicer and quiet the second night. Our coffe maker did not work, but the hotel sent up a pot of coffee from room service which was nice. The parking charge was a shocker, $28 per night. The bathroom doors were odd, sliders that had 1 inch gaps---so much for privacy. When I went to use the business center internet to browse dinner and tour info, it was a fee basis like $6 per 10 minutes---very nickel and dime for a hotel that charges $349 per nite. Not the hotel I expected, very nice but it had a business feel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OilIsle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni while in town for a convention. The hotel is everything one can ask for from a convention hotel. The facilities are new, modern, and clean. The pool area is particularly nice. Service is excellent, and every amenity expected from this caliber hotel is available. Hotel is directly across the street from the convention center, near a train stop, attached to Petco Park, and directly next to the entrance arch for the Gaslamp. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone in town for a convention; would also be excellent for business and family tourism.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is a beautiful hotel that is classy from the lobby to my room. The front desk and lobby personel were fabulous! They provide personal wake up calls. This property hires qualified people to work their positions. The hotel is about 4 years old and sits rock throwing distance from the Padres home diamond. It is less than a five minute walk to the convention center. The hotel beds were fantastic, as were the views of the bay. I was able to walk to any restaurant with ease and felt safe along the way. There is only one restaurant in the hotel so plan on spending some money on food if eating in the hotel. I highly suggest staying at the Omni San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: Musu
Reviews.Content: I went there for ESRI annual conference. The hotel is right opposite the conference hall and my room being on the 20th floor, I could view the port, the convention center and the trains. The trains do make some noise but nothing that will make you up. It is located such that you can go down and in 5 mins get the best restaurants (even if you are a veggie like me)..Do not go in the hotel's restaurant as it is very expensive. The room did not have a fridge. But upon request it was kept inside. THe room was very clean and the service was great. The bathroom door does not have a lock, so it was a little problem since I had to share my room with some one whom I did not know. Overall the hotel is just great and I would stay back if I ever go San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Beautiful View!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrlnyc
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is exactly how it has been described in so many reviews on this site. Getting to the hotel on a game night is almost impossible. You can hear the trains from the rooms. The bathroom door doesn't really provide a lot of privacy. HOWEVER, I WOULD TOTALLY STAY THERE AGAIN! We had a great experience at the Omni. The staff is really helpful. The hotel is also adequately staffed. There was never a wait for the car, room service, etc. The rooms are big, with nice modern decor and great views. The large bathrooms stock the typical Omni products and two decent robes. The beds and linens are great. If you are Omni Select you get complimentary drinks and your choice of newspaper in the morning--- which is a nice touch. It also comes with complimentary internet (high speed- no wireless). I think you can get the free internet even if your aren't Omni Select. It is also worth it to join Omni Select for the express check-in. You can check-in the day before online. You get to the hotel...and you are already checked in and your keys are waiting for you. It really does save a lot of time. Literally---NO WAITING! You just go right on up to your room. The pool and jacuzzi area is very pretty. There are lots of lounge chairs. On a game day Saturday, the pool was packed. On game day Sunday it wasn't crowded at all. The pool has a very adult feel. However, both days there were several children playing. They seemed to have a good time. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it for children, and it isn't necessarily a place where you are guaranteed a relaxing adult afternoon. The pool towels are great and serviced regularly. Room service happily provides service to the area. The gym is a nice size and has plenty of cardio equipment. They provide plenty of water and a nice fruit bowl. The gym is just off the pool area and does have a shower. You can easily check out...stay by the pool...and shower in the gym before your flight. There is only one-shower in the gym...so plan ahead if you are with a big group. The location is great for the downtown area. There are lots of restaurants, stores, etc. within walking distance. Horton Plaza is about a 10 minute walk. Seaport Village is about a 15 minute walk. There are also lots of pedicabs in the area. Here are some tips that will help your trip. If you are a light sleeper---bring ear plugs. On Friday and Saturday nights it is possibly that you will hear your neighbors and the train. Call the hotel before and get directions to the hotel on game nights. Downtown San Diego has a lot of one-way streets and many of them close on game nights. It is terribly frustrating trying to get there with Mapquest, Google Maps, etc. The bathroom doors are not typical and you can feel exposed in the bathroom. If you are traveling with a co-worker or someone you don't really know...this might not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 911GOLFER
Reviews.Content: Finally, a hotel who knows how to do it right! I got a great rate on Priceline, and although the parking fee is a bit much, the service and cleanliness makes up for it. I LOVED the bathroom door. The bed was very comfy, and I loved the personal touch wake up call. I am used to an automated wake up call, and almost hung up on the guy. We faced downtown, and didn't hear any noise from trains or cranes. The room was immaculate and we are looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, watch out for the train...”
Reviews.Author: EleanorSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite an excellent hotel. The location is fantastic; you are one block from the gaslamp district. The decor is great and the place is very modern. The rooms are spacious and luxirious. Very comfortable king-sized beds and DVD players are in each room. The view is great. However, there are trains that right right by downtown San Diego every few hours. It is very loud, and it will wake you up at 2am every day. Bring your ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. Also, be careful when there is a Padres baseball game. There are tons of people who walk by and there are parties in the hotel. The hotel is literally connected to the baseball stadium, so if baseball is not your cup of tea, be careful if there is a game going on. It can be quite rowdy. Overall, it is a great hotel, great location. I would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Planning to return”
Reviews.Author: Merlinbike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved our stay here. We had tickets for the ballgame, and the place really comes alive on game nights. Hot tip, across from the main entrance to the hotel on game days, there is a great deal on burgers, hot dogs and beer so check it out. Although there is some construction going near the hotel, we did not find that the noise was too bad. After reading some of the reviews, we were also concerned about the train whistle noise, but once again, not problem. Staff is exceptional and courteous. Great location within easy walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter and trolley stations. Only negative was not much shelf space to put shaving, makeup kit in the bathroom. We plan to return, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Omni!”
Reviews.Author: lpsimmons
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego was more than I expected. The customer service was phenomenal. The hotel and bar were both first class. This was a summer family trip and we all loved it. Everything is very close to the hotel and there's wonderful restaurants and shopping nearby. The only problem was the nightly train coming by, but with the exceptional hotel we didn't even care about waking up to the train. The last night we went to an Astros/Padres game. We took the walkway from the hotel to Petco Park and that was awesome. What a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Location - Great !”
Reviews.Author: nebnair
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for 4 nights.The experience - here goes..... *Getting there - hardly 10- 15 mins drive from the airport. *Parking - Valet Pros: Very fast service;friendly staff;unlimited in and gos at no extra charge. Cons: ur wallet is lighter by $26 each day. Advice: I thght the parking lot was just across the street.so do some research and park it there urself, if u wanna save some $s. *Location - A.W.E.S.O.M.E for night life and stomach. Pros: Nice bars and lotsa restaurants near by.Therez even a pharmacy abt 4-5 blocks from the hotel. Cons: Short drives to most of the beaches. *Room Pros: Nice baths. Cons: Getting a room with a good view is a lil difficult.I thght the A/c had some problem -felt like it wasnt working. All in all a nice place for the extra $$s.Go for something else if ocean view is wat u have in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Consistant affordable luxury with great pool scene”
Reviews.Author: Matt F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our stay at the Omni and could not be more pleased. While I've stayed at the property before for business, this was my first weekend stay for leisure. We were in town for a wedding and while most stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp we decided to stay at the Omni. While each hotel is located next to the Petco Park (SD Padres), the big difference came during the day when we could lay out by the pool at the Omni enjoying live music (Jimmy Buffet/ Bob Marley covers) as we rested up for the night. The Marriott Gaslamp offers no pool but it does offer a very popular night club, Altitude, on the roof. We enjoyed a great night there and loved the one block walk back to the Omni. Regarding the room... we upgraded to a deluxe and were pleased with extra space and corner views of the bay. Rooms are of modern decor with a small balcony and great beds. Bathrooms are average size with nice amenities. I highly recommend the Omni San Diego for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel But beware of the train”
Reviews.Author: VizziOne
Reviews.Content: Great location, walked to all the local bars and shopping. The only problem is the 3 am train that goes right by the hotel.The rooms are great had a rate of 109.00 a night on travelzoo. Would stay again but bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: utahania
Reviews.Content: Great property for a meeting at the San Diego Convention Center. Not as spendy as the Marriott and doesn't include a big outdoor pool setup like the Marriott, but if you are here for bussiness that's probably irrelevant anyway. Honestly, I have never seen a hotel staff as good as at the Omni. Someone in upper management is doing their job because everyone on the staff seems to have a vision of taking personal responsibility for the guests. It was impressive. A few examples: some guy had my bag and opened the door for me as soon as my cab stopped (not too surprising, but a good start). Concierge has a map of running routes. I was eating a snack in the lobby, some management person walked by in a suit and tie. He saw some trash on the floor. Stopped turned around and picked it up. Small things, but it was impressive to watch an organization function this well. And it makes for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Omni San Diego - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeahsLuvly
Reviews.Content: Overall, I got a great price at about $179/night on Hotwire. The hotel was wonderful with a few exceptions. 1. Construction is underway right across the street and it starts early. Be ready for tractor beeping as soon as the sun begins to rise. 2. The train runs right across the street as well. Whistle blowing tended to wake us up almost every night. 3. The hotel sells spa treatments, but it has no spa. I scheduled a massage and had to find my way through the fitness center to a massage room. I heard the treadmills and squeaky stationary bikes the entire time - not my idea of relaxation. There was no relaxation or quiet room, water or tea...for what they charge, I would go to the Hyatt for a true spa experience next time. On a positive note, the valet and concierge were very helpful. They were very eager to give directions and assistance.The hotel was beautiful and in a great location - close to 5th Ave. and attached to the Petco Field. While in San Diego, be sure to visit Osteria Panevino and Soleil - both exceptional restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but some problems”
Reviews.Author: GlobeExpat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice place. The only bad things I can say are the walls are paper thin. We could hear the people next to us talk and they decided to have a big party at 2AM which woke us up and they wouldn't stop even after security visited them. Also I didn't like the parking situation. I don't want to valet my car for 28 euros a day. Here is a tip, the parking garage across the street charges a maximum of $16 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: jtnwdc
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel quite plain and the staff unhelpful--and in a couple instances, rude. I arrived late and asked for a quiet nonsmoking room. I was assured of a quiet room. The room I was given is literally next to PETCO Stadium and the roar from the crowd and the revelers was intense both nights of my stay. Another guest I spoke with said her room, on the other side of hotel by the Convention Center, was also loud, with Amtrak and commuter trains and traffic noise constant. I went back to the desk and asked the manager on duty for a quiet room, perhaps something interior. He said, "Well, there are basically no quiet rooms in the hotel with the stadium on one side and trains running on the other. The Marriott down the street is actually quite nice and quiet. Stay away from the OMNI unless you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice... but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Blumagoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over the 4th of July holdiday. I booked on travelzoo at a rate of $99.00 per night. For what we paid I felt like this hotel was a steal. If I paid the rack rate I wouldn't have thought it was so great. We had a city view room. (1431) The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was clean. On the downside: the drain in the tub was broken, there were the beginnings of mold on the tub grouting, and the paint on the walls was far from fresh. I have to mention that the staff at this hotel is superior. I did utilize the concierge service and the valet parking. I did not experience any of the valet problems that were mentioned in previous reviews. Everyone was very friendly, courteous and PROMPT! The pool area is very small but they do have a nice bar service. Signing up for Omni Select and getting the free morning beverage service was a plus. If you could get a rate under $200.00 I would recommend for you to take it! As a side note- getting in and out of the hotel area with a car during game hours is a bit of a hassle and not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess9
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Los Angeles and decided to drive to San Diego and site see. Booked the hotel through Priceline. Some of the reviews complained about the bathroom and noise. I could see where someone might be a little self-concious about the bathroom door being slightly ajar when you close it, but the bathroom was no problem for us. As a matter of fact, it's spacious and upscale. Beautiful. The room was large and wonderfully relaxing, until late at night with all of the noise from the trolleys. Even with the windows closed (and we were on a very high floor) you could hear the noise of trolleys, construction, etc. So, that wasn't pleasant. However, that withstanding, the hotel is downtown, attached to the baseball stadium and directly in the heart of the restaurant and club district. Next to the convention center. Very easy to drive to all attractions. The parking was expensive (in my opinion it should be cheaper for what they charge you for the rooms.). The beds are AMAZING! It was hard to wake up because they are so comfortable. The staff was cordial, but not overly friendly. The hotel is clean and high tech. The restaurant attached - McCormick - had excellent food, but was a bit pricey. It was amazing just to be able to walk downtown and hit a bunch of restaurants and clubs and walk back to the hotel. Can't beat that. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: hepsales
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for three nights and stayed in three different hotels (all 4*). The San Diego Omni exceeded all others hands down. Excellent fitness room (they even provide fresh fruit), comfy bathrobes and extremely courteous staff. Only problem is traffic on game days (it's right next to Petro Park), but that goes for all of Gas Lamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “A well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: nandj
Reviews.Content: Sleek and stylish hotel. Nice amenities and careful attention to detail. Excellent housekeeping. Stayed 5 nights. Not disappointed. Valet parking is pricey. Better to use the municipal lot across the street unless you are in-out frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAKarenOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: I have to first say that I stayed here after 2 nights at the Four Seasons in Carlsbad. So after being fully pampered, at a much higher cost, this hotel is somewhat stark. My son and I were going to see a Padres game so the hotel location was perfect. The rooms and bathrooms are average. Good for a business traveler. I checked in on-line before I left home and did not have to go to the front desk to check into the hotel. Again good for a business traveler, but in a way strange. Not a lot of "welcoming" from the staff. Even my jaded 10 year old wondered if we had pulled up to the right spot, when no one from the valet came and opened up our car doors and said, "Welcome to the Omni" or something like that. Overall the hotel was clean, rooms have a bit of the funny hotel smell, and very good location for Padre/Petco stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 68braveheart
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in June for business. The Omni is adjacent to the ball park which would make this the perfect place to stay for baseball or football games. This location (on non game days) is quite ,yet only a short walk to all the action. Restaurants, bars, etc are abundant and within minutes. The hotel has a McCormick & Schmick's seafood restaurant in the lobby, however it lacks any feel of having its own restaurant. The rooms are a good size and the bath is modern with shelves and glass, however they lack real room for most shaving/toiletry bags. Beds are very comfortable and wake up service was on time and actually a real person. Overall, this seems to be a popular business hotel, but would be a great spot for sports fans as well. Mission Bay is more of the resort area and would be the better choice with beach seeking travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Zen Decor”
Reviews.Author: splitnfragments
Reviews.Content: I love the Omni's location. It is in the heart of the Gaslamp quarter and is connected to Petco Park, so if you want to see a Padre's game, you don't even have to walk across the street...just through a bridge on the second floor of the Omni. The rooms are beautifully decorated and clean...very zen. The only thing that's weird is the bathroom door. It's a sliding door that doesn't close all the way. Since I came here on a work-related trip and had a roommate that I didn't know, it was weird to have a bathroom like that.

Reviews.Title: “Great As Expected (Use Hotwire For SD/Gaslamp!!!)”
Reviews.Author: samdogNY
Reviews.Content: Hotel is top notch.... was there April 2007.... Ask for room in main tower..... better views and sun.... Tip 1: the TRAIN NOISE is a significant..... the trolley.train stop is adjacent to hotel... being from NY i didnt think i would care and kinda like the sounds but that damn wistle was LOUD and at 2 3 4am wasnt the most enjoyable.... and keep in mind i was on the 17th floor! ... BUT i do like the windows open and keeping them closed did pretty much eliminate that issue.... BIG TIP 2 --- USE HOTWIRE. for San Diego GASLAMP ... this is the perfect area for hotwire.... there are only 3 or 4 4* hotels w/pools in the Gaslamp and they are ALL very very nice and basically w/in 2 blocks of eachother..... so it would be very hard to go wrong on Hotwire if you slect a 4* Hotel w/pool in the Gaslamp.... I got the Omni for $170 or $179 a night on hotwire when it was listing on expedia/hotels for $272 .... enjoy

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: charlie7957
Reviews.Content: WOW!! What a wonderful hotel!! This is the first time we have ever stayed in a 4 star hotel and will stay here again. From the moment I called to ask for a King Sized Bed, Non Smoking Room and view of the harbor until the time we checked out was the most wonderful experience. The staff is extremely accommodating. I mentioned during my phone call real quick that we wanted a harbor view because we were coming for my 50th birthday. Well - the Reservation Agent apparently listened to my every word!!! There was a box of chocolates as well as a Birthday Card in the room when we showed up. What a wonderful surprise!!! The only SLIGHT downfall to the stay was driving through downtown to get to the hotel. There were Baseball games the 3 days that we stayed there and we got tangled up in the traffic. But we certainly couldn't blame Omni for that!!!! It was great to be able to see the game on TV and hear the cheering of the crowd from our balcony. It was almost as if we were attending the game!!! We most definitely will stay here again!!! Thank you Omni!!!!

Reviews.Title: “almost everything but the parking”
Reviews.Author: barbara451
Reviews.Content: I live in northern San Diego county and stayed at the Omni to take advantage of the "skybridge" to the ballpark. My room was excellent. To my surprise, It had been upgraded. The decor is modern, clean and well-kept. I loved the louvered walls and doors to the bathroom; a very artistic and unique design. The front desk clerk, Ivana, was great as were all the employees. Room service might has heated my morning muffn in the microwave for a couple of seconds, but ... The parking situation, however, I find ludicrous and I am very curious as to how this situation has been arranged with the city. I was willing to pay the nightly fee; I just wanted to drive my own car to the parking garage. The hotel would not allow me to do that so I parked in the same garage across the street for less money. In essence, the hotel lost money and I achieved my goal of parking my own car--in the same parking garage just on a different level of the garage- which I recommend to future guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: sabearo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several of the top hotels in the San Diego area and our week at the Omni proved to be a great success. First of all location, location. The hotel is situated in the Gaslamp district which is pretty much where you will find all the best restaurants and shopping that downtown San Diego has to offer. It is a 10 minute walk to the Marina just past the massive Convention Center . The service at the Omni is excellent. The front desk staff is courteous and efficient and as usual it is the little things that one remembers. A child in our party was having one of those "my loose tooth won't fall out upsets" and this lovely girl at the reception ran to get her an apple to bite into and sure enough out flew the tooth! The pool is situated a few floors up on a rooftop and is a very pleasant and uncrowded way to relax after a busy day sightseeing. Valet parking was quick and worth the expense. (You are not going to fing parking around there anyway). We also enjoyed the restaurant McCormick and Schmicks, although the breakfast buffet was discontinued while we were there. But the cuisine was good including the late supper menu. San Diego and environs is an amazing playground both for children and adults.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in SD - from a Local”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer10
Reviews.Content: Bar none, the best hotel in the city. Better than the Manchester Grand Hyatt, which is nice as well. Much better than the Marriotts and a better value than Hotel Solamar. I am from San Diego, and have stayed at dozens of local hotels for one reason or another, and this one takes the cake. The rooms are extremely modern, comfortable, and clean. They have a very sleek feel to them. The location is easily the best place to stay in the city as well -- because it is close enough to the Gaslamp restaurants and bars without being right in it, so you tend to stay away from the noise while being a few blocks away from everything. If you book a 4-Star Hotel in the Gaslamp through Hotwire, you more than likely will get the Omni at a highly discounted rate. Be nice and ask the front desk upon check-in for an upgraded or high level room, and they will most likely give you whatever is available. Parking is a bit spendy, so if you are staying at the Omni not on a Padre game night, park across the street in the multi level garage. If you are there on a game night, suck it up and valet because you won't be saving more than a couple bucks parking across the street or anywhere else downtown. Location, value, friendly staff, quick valet, energetic feel, and some of the nicest basic hotel rooms contribute to this being the best option in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KDP650
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Diego Omni in April 2007 while attending a conference at the San Diego Convention Center and the location could not have been more convenient. The hotel is directly across the street from the convention center. It is also located at the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter, making it within an easy 5 minute or less walk to dozens of many great restaurants. Also, McCormick & Schmick´s Seafood Restaurant located in the Omni hotel was excellent! The dinner we had there was some of the best food we have had anywhere. They are also open for traditional breakfast too, although we did have the chance to eat breakfast there. The Omni staff were all very friendly and courteous and the hotel itself was very clean and well-maintained from what I could tell. Our guest room had a beautiful view of the bay and was tastefully decorated, quite comfortable, with a quality king-size bed. I used the pool and hot tub several days and nights. The regular pool was kept very warm when we were there, like bathwater, and it was very relaxing, especially in the evenings. They also had a decent fitness center, with complimentary fruit. The the only negative, which others have mentioned here too, is the lack of privacy of the bathrooms in the rooms. There were plantation style shutters separating the bathroom and the bed area and while they could be closed, there was absolutely no sound privacy at all. If you are at all shy about such things with who you are sharing the room with, you may want to make use of the public restrooms located in other areas of the hotel. I did. I think the bathroom design, while visually interesting, was not very practical and may turn off some people. Other than that, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great if you are going to Padres Games”
Reviews.Author: bw331
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is a nice hotel. That being said, I don't think it was as nice as some of these reviewers (and I'm not sure it's the best hotel in the city). The hotel is relatively new and the location is very close to the Gaslamp quarter, which is nice and the Convention Center. The coolest thing about this hotel is that it is connected to PETCO Park. It could not be easier to watch a Padres game from this hotel. From the fourth floor there is a bridge that takes you directly into the park. After the game was over I was in my hotel room in 5 minutes. That was really neat. Although room service is 24 hours, the menu becomes extremely limited after 10pm and this is a definite drawback, as I couldn't get anything sweet when I got in late at night. The staff was okay, I thought the concierge was particularly bad. My room was good; I really have no complaints about it. Definitely, sign up for Omni Select Guest like other reviewers said. It gets you free internet, complimentary morning beverage and paper service and more. Overall, good hotel and I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Four2Ski
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at an Omni Hotel, and I was really blown away. The service was outstanding, and the property was tremendous. The room was very large with a comfortable bed loaded with pillows. The bathroom was large as well, with a full compliment of luxury amenities. The location is excellent, close to the convention center, the water, and the Gaslamp District. There is a nice restaurant on site, but there are better ones nearby, such as Acqua Al 2 (pronounced acqua al due) for great Italian food. If you’re looking for luxurious accommodations in San Diego with a great location, the Omni will exceed your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: truprunbike
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Omni May 11-14 and loved just about everything about it. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The location is perfect. There are tons of restaurants within a 10 second to 5 minute walk. We did not eat at the Omni because there are so many other delicious restaurants around. There are alos a few mini marts nearby if you want to buy a case of beer or wine and some chips and dip for the room. You can also easily walk to Horton Plaze, Seaport Village, and the Cruise Ship Terminals, or its about a $8 cab ride. We used the skybridge to go to Petco Park a few times and that was very convenient. This hotel is also where the Cardinals and their families stayed and being a huge Cardinal fan, I loved that. The pool was a little small, but very nice. Never a problem getting a lounge. There is a great nightlife in that area, from upscale martini bars, club bars, or just chill bars. The beds at the Omni are super comfortable, and the bathroom was quite spacious, It had a tub and shower. There was plenty of shelf space for all my wifes stuff in the bathroom. We were on the 7th floor and never heard any trains or any other noise from the pool or from Petco park. We got a great rate through priceline, but would recommend it if even paying the full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: NBChrista
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni with a colleague for 6 nights during a conference in early May, 2007. It came out "two thumbs up" for my three main hotel priorities: good staff, cleanliness, and proximity to attractions. The staff were professional, courteous, and highly efficient. The concierge with constantly helpful with directions, maps, restaurant suggestions (Rama, the Thai restaurant, is a MUST for an outstanding lunch). When one of our bags was waylaid by Air Canada, two toothbrushes, paste, and other assorted essential toiletries appeared in our bathroom. We were impressed. The cleaning was impeccable. The room was well cleaned daily and the pool and fitness areas were also tidy and well cared for. The pool water, when accidentally ingested, was a little reminiscent of pee, but I think that was probably unavoidable due to the conference resulting in tons of kids in the pool at a time. Finally, the proximity of this hotel to all things important and exciting in San Diego CANNOT be overemphasized. Due to the layout of the convention center, we had a shorter walk to the conference (maybe 200 yards) than our colleagues staying at the Marriott (which is actually ATTACHED to the convention center, but at the far end of it). We were on the edge of the famous Gaslamp District with its excellent shopping and restaurants, a short (10-15 minutes) walk to Seaport Village, the dock, and the fabulous Horton shopping complex (complete with Nordstrom's and many high-end small boutique stores), and a moderate walk (30-40 minutes) to famous Balboa Park and San Diego Zoo. The hotel location is conducive to pedestrian travel. Of course, no review is complete without a critique or two. The elevators were so slow as to be the subject of many amused (and not-so-amused) comments by guests. On our longest trip we made a full NINE stops between the lobby and the 19th floor where we were staying. We were told that this was related to the unusual volume of conference traffic. The restaurant/lounge was a little expensive even by San Diego standards (we didn't try it as a result). Our "conference rate" for the hotel seemed somewhat exhorbitant at $USD 239 (although comparable to other local hotels at that time). The hotel-supplied hair conditioner is atrocious, bring your own. In summary, this is a well-cared-for, well-run hotel with staff who are a real asset to Omni. Highly recommended if you can get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Harold
Reviews.Content: Before we managed to escape from the Bahia hotel I managed to book the Omni hotel for $100 on priceline for the next 2 nights ( same price as Bahia 100 times better). Checkin went very smooth , we got some input what room we wanted . Based on the reviews here I decided to get one away from the rail track. This meant the back of the building with a view over Petco park, but unfortunately I could still see some of the rail track as we had a corner froom with 2 windows. The freight train did pass by a couple of times each night and it did not really bother us - and I am quite a light sleeper. The location is perfect , 100 m walk to the gaslamp quarter. Parking can be done in the parking structure across the hotel for $ 12 a night when there is a game on and less if there is no game. However it does not allow you to get your car in and out. This works well if you are out and about during the day and return in the afternoon in the hotel and then go out in the gaslamp quarter. I thank the reviewer that mentioned to sign up for their Select Guest program. Do that online when you book the hotel, quote the number upon check in and enjoy complimentary fresh hot and cold beverage in the morning + a paper. You can buy bagels or crossaints to go with that and all of a sudden you have a cheap in-room breakfast. If there is a game on you will have to wait until 10 PM to get to sleep, but that is not a problem in this part of town. The room was spacious and well laid out. Yes, the bathroom doors are still there, but you'll get used to that. Internet access for free with your laptop at a reasonable speed. All in all, one of the better hotels we stayed in during our vacation in SW USA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my two-night stay at the Omni. Check-in was quick and courteous. My "premium" room on the 12th floor was quite large and on a corner, with a view of the bay out one window and of Petco Park out the other. While I felt close enough to the stadium to practically touch it, I was not high enough to see into the stadium. I did go to a Padres game--it's very convenient because there's a skyway on the 4th floor of the hotel that leads directly into the park. The view of the bay is somewhat spoiled by the convention center across the steet (see photo). I could hear the trains passing a couple of times a night below; I might suggest a room facing San Diego's downtown skyline (very pretty at night) for those bothered by that. The room was nicely decorated, with attractive use of wood and modern furniture. The king-size bed was extremely comfortable; however, I felt the sheets could have been smoother. The flat-screen TV was great. I agree with other reviewers that the bathroom is different--the door closes by pulling two doors together (but no gap problems that I could see). I liked the louver arrangement others have commented on--when I opened them, it felt like having windows in the bathroom; I could see the bay as I was getting ready in the morning. I ordered room service for dinner, and the food (salmon) was excellent though expensive (about $40 including service fees). Amenities in the room are of excellent quality--especially loved the scented soap. One tip - I first thought there was no coffeemaker but then found it and coffee and tea supplies in a cabinet under the TV. I felt that the hotel doesn't have enough elevators--there was often a wait at busy times. As to value, I was there for a conference, and so had a special rate of $139; it seems the regular rates are much higher. If you're a baseball fan, though, this could be a great place to stay and catch a game--check out the baseball memorabilia on the 4th level of the hotel. All in all, a nice stay in a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recomended!!”
Reviews.Author: dcaiani
Reviews.Content: Lets start with a flawless check in. Fast and courteous! The staff in general were all very professional and very friendly! The rooms were spacious and very modern. The one (I'll call it a weird thing) that was off about the room was the louvered windows that were between the sleeping are and the bathroom. Being that I was alone it didn't make a difference, but it made for total lack of privacy while using the bathroom. The bathroom itself was large and very well appointed. The coolest thing about this hotel was the view of Petco that I got when I walked out of my room. I could se the left 1/3 of the field! I just wish it had been baseball season. By the way, take the ballpark tour if you have some time to kill! Breakfast was very pricey. I wasn't paying for it so it didn't bother me so much, but if I was ..... Location is great. Its right across the street from the convention center, across the street from Petco, and right at the base of the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: weets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in April 2007 on the back of the reviews on this site. Booked on Expedia in the UK 3 weeks before and got room only for 3 people for £75 ($150) per night. Our experince of this hotel was very positive indeed. I have read alot of the reviews and I have to agree with the majority of reviewers - this is a well run, clean and conveneint hotel. Our room on the 9th floor overlooked the convention centre and yes, there is train noise (this seems to be due to there being a crossing at 5th and Harbor and train drivers seem intent on sounding the horn repeatedly as they approach). Did it spoil the stay? No. The room had 2 double beds, the linen being clean and the beds were comfortable. All of the decor was tidy and clean and the coffeee maker was stocked up daily. The bathroom is great - ours was clean and everyting worked well - the decor is very contemporary and there is a great stock of soap, shampoo etc - even a small mouthwash and sew kit. The door is a bit odd but the gap isn't a problem (but you cannot lock the bathroom door). Ate breakfast in the onsite restaurant which is OK but a bit pricey. Morsel's coffee bar is good and sells Starbucks! Only real gripe is room service - pricey to begin with but prices do not include extras such as 20% service and $3 delivery charges! A cup of Starbucks delivered to the room is something like $14!!! We found the staff were very friendly during our stay - to the extent that the doorman would greet you on your return with a "welcome back!" We did use the valet parking and it isn't cheap but I had no problems (the 4 nights we were there coincided with 4 evening Padre games - when a game is on, downtown is chaotic and self parking a nightmare). Close by are all attractions (valet will give you a map and offer directions) and it is a 10 minute walk to Seaport. Lots of resturants etc close by incluing Hard Rock on 4th - about 15 minutes to walk. Overall, do not be put off by some negative reviews. There will always be some things that go wrong with a hotel but the vast majority of reviews rate this place highly. I woudl definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why this one rates so high”
Reviews.Author: melissatrv
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit on business and was in San Diego for a convention. This hotel was not my first choice but my first choice was booked. I agree with everyone on the location, it is centrally located and you can walk or take a short cab ride to many area attractions. However, there are several better hotels in this same area. I booked a non-smoking king room and was given a smoking room with double beds. I knew the second I opened the door to the room and my throat was on fire from the second-hand smoke. The bell captain called the front desk to see if I could switch and was told the hotel was completely booked and there were absolutely no rooms available. I went to the front desk myself and was told the same thing. When I asked to speak to a manager, he left me there waiting with no explanation and then returned 10 minutes later saying they had a non-smoking room. Magic perhaps? I am not sure why I had to go through 2 other channels and escalate to a manager before being given a non-smoking room. The room was still a double but I was fine with that, the smoke was the main concern. Anyway, the decor is rather old looking, internet access is hit or miss, the bathroom is odd and there is not much room on the shelves for your personal items. I ordered room service and the french dip sandwhich was salty and the french fries cold. There was also a lot of noise in the outside area and difficult to sleep. Another thing I did not like was the bathroom door. It is this funny styled door which does not close completely. This was not a big problem for me as I was traveling alone, but if I was not this would be a major issue as you would have no privacy. I would stay at another hotel in the Gaslamp district if I am in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Marielia
Reviews.Content: In early April, we stayed at the Omni Hotel for part of our vacation. The hotel is in a great location. Its close to the trolley, shopping, restaurants, convention center, & petco park. The rooms were nicely decorated. The mattress and linens were very very comfortable. The hotel was quiet and there weren't any wierd smells. The staff was very accomodating. The pool area was ok. Its not very big, but it wasn't at all crowded when we went up there. There is a salt water jacuzzi, which is makes your skin really soft. We did a lot of tourist attractions while we were there. My favs were the wild animal park, the midway museum, and the russian submarine. For nightlife, my fav was the shouthouse, which is a piano bar in the gaslamp area. The zoo and balboa park were good too.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking ruined the vacation”
Reviews.Author: duly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice but the Valet parking is what ruins the stay there. I have a brand new car (one month on the road) the valet parking took it and damaged it. when they returned it they didn't say anything but i have noticed the damage immediately. at start they didn't want to give me a copy of the report they filled but later on they did, the manager explained that they will pay for the damage. one day after returning home, i got a letter from the manager saying that they investigated the issue and the damage wasn't done by them. I have 3 people with me to back up my saying that they car was not damage before given to them that night. now i read the reviews about the hotel it seems that i'm not the first one to have that experience with the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: jimjade3
Reviews.Content: It is rare to have the opportunity to view up close a truly superior and well trained staff in the American hotel industry. I had this opportunity at the Omni San Diego this past week. I almost did not stay here due to parking and location issues but was glad I made the decision to be an Omni guest. Two very qualified concierges manned the information desk at most all waking hours and they were full of suggestions and could field an answer for almost any need. The housekeeping and front desk and valet parking people were equally helpful and always friendly. The lobbies, public spaces, pool and gym were all very attractive and well maintained. The rooms were very comfortable with perfect mattresses, better sheets than I have at home, robes, supplies, etc. I liked the "louvered doors" which slide open to make the bathroom sort of a part of the room, (but I can understand the reasons some reviewers might feel this compromises privacy). I did notice, that even though the hotel is pretty new, it must be getting used a lot by the baseball and convention crowds (Hotel sits between the baseball stadium and the convention center) and there was some minor carpet wear, tiny hole in comforter, and wear on the chair. Hopefully the management will catch these things before they begin to drag the place down. There are a couple of other glitches but none would stop me from staying here again. As most people mention, paying $26 for parking is a drag. However, I must say that the valets had my car to me in no time and in-and-outs are included in the bill. Some friends paid $15 for a parking deck a block away but could only take the car out once a day. The nearest free street parking looked to be about a 20 minute walk away, up by Balboa Park. The other problem mentioned by members of my group is the blowing of a whistle or horn by a nearby freight train in the wee hours of the morning. I heard it but quickly went back to sleep. You might discuss this when making reservations and ask for a room facing away from the train location...but then this might also knock you out of a view of the bay. If you have one, you might consider taking along a battery powered "white noise" machine which masks out sounds of the night. I forgot mine this trip. (You can get these at places like Sharper Image). Despite these glitches, I heartily recommend this hotel. It was a great experience. My rate was $131 (but it was a group rate for my conference/class so I can't comment on the relative value of normal rates). I found that the hospitality spilled over to the hotel restaurant, McCormick and Schmidt. Though a little pricier than I would have preferred, I had a good meal there and they honored a special diet request with good cheer.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Issue”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most reviews that the Omni San Diego is a great place to stay. Unfortunately, my second time staying at this hotel was not so great. This past weekend, I stayed at the Omni for one night. The room and the service were great. Everything was in working order and prompt. There were two major problems happened during my stay except the following: The first problem was the noise issue. I had room 1601. It was one of those room that connects to the adjoining room. Nothing was wrong with that arrangement until two AM in the morning. There was a bunch of young women (think sority) talking and screaming loudly. It was as though they were in our room. I called the front desk (or the "immediate service" or something like that) but there was no answer. I came down to the front desk and explained to them the problem. They said they can send security up. I told them that would be a possible solution. However, I also told them that those women were talking loudly but it was in their room. I needed my sleep but at the same time, I felt that those women should be able to talk as it was "their" room. Instead, they gave us another room to sleep in without having to move my things. I thought that was a very nice gesture of them. The second problem had to do with the valet parking. The valet parking costed me 27 dollars per night with in and out previleges. There was no self parking. There was so much scratches and chipped paint damaged to my car. My car is relatively new. I knew that the scratch must have taken place during the my stay at the Omni because I had washed and waxed the car right before I left for San Diego. I did not use my car during my stay at the hotel. I called the manager and explained the situation. He was then informed me that the parking manager would call me. The parking manager called me two hours later and explained that they contract with Ace Parking. Furthermore, they will pay for the repair. The damage to my car was not that major. At the same, when you handed them your car, it is expected that they would take care of it. It just principle of things. If you need a place to stay in downtown San Diego, the Omni is a fine place. However, if you have a car, just be aware that they might damage your car. I would not stay there again especially if I drive and have to use their valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away”
Reviews.Author: abrous
Reviews.Content: This is not my first stay at this hotel, but this is the best experience I have had to date. Everything was very prompt, from the time I pulled up to the Valet, to the time I entered my room, it took less than 10 minutes. The bell staff was very attentive and prompt with delivery of my luggage. I had also brought my pet along with me on this trip and everyone was very friendly and sincere when dealing with her. The only thing that went wrong was my room when I first checked in. The room had not yet been made up, it was a mess. The front desk manager was up within minutes, apologizing and quickly escorted me to another room. Because of their error, they upgraded me to a corner room at twice the size of my original booked room. This room also had a balcony. All at no extra charge. After settling in, I took my dog for a walk along the marina and when I returned about an hour later, I was surprised to return to my room with a few extras. They had delivered some doggie treats for my pet, provided me with a fresh bottle of water for my pet and as a way of apologizing for the earlier snafu, they had given me a nice bottle of wine and a box of chocolates along with a hand written apology and thanking me for my patience. Now, This is how a guest should be treated at an establishment when the hotel has made a screw up. I am very very pleased with this experience and I would recommend anyone coming to San Diego to book their room at the Omni. (the rooms were clean and very well decorated, and the bathroom issue that I have read here in the past has been resoved and they hvae replaced the bathroom doors so that they give total privacy now.)

Reviews.Title: “First-rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: tvchip
Reviews.Content: A beautiful property, next door to Petco Park and within a block or two of the famed Gaslamp District. Very close to 100 or so restaurants. Service was terrific all the way through.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonesyboston
Reviews.Content: We arrived this hotel on 3/4 for a conference. The front desk receptionists were friendly. However, even though we paid for valet parking, there was no one on the curbside when I arrived. The receptionist had to help us with luggage as there was no bell captain. We were given room 903 and on the way up the elevator, we encountered someone who was clearly a prosititute (we arrived at almost midnight). The hallway was nicely decorated and clean. However, the carpet in the room had stains. Then one of the pillows had hair on it and I had to call housekeeping for clean pillowcases. The curtain was so dusty to the point that it looked disgustingly stained. There were holes in the shower curtain and hair on the bathroom floor. And as mentioned in previous reviews by other people, the bathroom door leaves about an inch of openning. When you turn on the bathroom sink faucet, it splashes you wet because of the way it's designed. This is definitely not a hotel that's worth $300 a night. We called the front desk but they claimed they didn't have a room for us to move to that night. So I went online right away and booked the Marriott Marina Hotel, which was truely a 5 star hotel in every way. I checked out the very next morning. I was given 50% discount and offered to talked to the manager to get another room. However, I didn't want to waste my time and the damage had been done. We would never stay in this hotel brand again.

Reviews.Title: “not sure what all the hype is about”
Reviews.Author: catraveler28
Reviews.Content: Encouraged by the stellar reviews on this site, we chose to stay at the Omni over other comparably priced downtown hotels. After my stay, I'm not quite sure what all the raves are about. The Omni clearly aspires to be more than the solid middle-of-the-road convention hotel that it is, but misses many of the important details. First, the positives: staff were uniformly friendly and helpful; check-in was easy; and the building is beautiful. The room was pleasant enough (although the sheets were scratchy and the mattress was uncomfortable, and there were only two pillows on the bed). The gym facility was great. But helpful staff aside, the hotel -- at least during our stay -- missed some of the small details that better hotels wouldn't let slip by. Valet attendants, while friendly, didn't offer to help with luggage. Our room was missing a hotel information guide/room service menu. Our package rate was supposed to include the parking fee, but it appeared on the bill nonetheless, requiring a trip to the front desk to get it fixed. A note left on the bedside table promised that the bedside clock would change automatically to reflect the "spring forward" daylight savings time change; it did not. Individually, these small things weren't a big deal at all, but cumulatively, it seemed like the hotel didn't quite have its act together. And as noted by many reviewers here, the bathroom door design is just ridiculous -- there is literally a one-inch gap between the door and the wall, giving anyone sitting in the bedroom a clear view directly of the toilet. If you're not extremely comfortable with your traveling companion, this is not the hotel for you. This is still a solid hotel, but I would stay at another hotel in San Diego - the Hotel Solamar, the remodeled U.S. Grant, or even the Hilton - before coming back to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: TAmember123
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Omni San Diego, and I enjoyed it as much as the first. time Great hotel, staff, location, fitness center, pool. Good business center. Valet parking is a little pricey, but comparable to other area hotels. Ask for a room high up and remember to ask about ball games, just in case you're looking out over Petco park. When we asked about an all-day breakfast place, the front desk staff recommended the Mission around 13th and J. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, No privacy in bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: MrsCARolph
Reviews.Content: My sister's and I spent one night in San Diego for a quick vacation, and we chose the Omni because the location was convenient, and it was one of the least expensive of the "nicer" hotels. Overall, we were satisfied... Pros: -Beautiful hotel--modern decor and high class atmosphere. -Great location! Close to the trendy Gas Lamp District, light rail, and other downtown attractions. -Wonderful staff--they were more than happy to help with all of our requests, and couldn't have been nicer. -Very clean, comfortable rooms--nice beds and a choice of pillows. -Gorgeous pool and hot tub--and we were the only ones in it! Cons: -There was no privacy in the bathroom!!!! The hotel has installed a trendy Japanese sliding door in the guest room's bathroom, but it didn't cover properly! The door was literally smaller than the hole in the wall it was supposed to cover! There was about 2 inches of space between the wall and the door! You would get more privacy in a public bathroom stall. Also, the door does nothing to muffle the noise between the bath and the room, which can be awkward. For the most part, this is a great hotel, but they MUST replace the bathroom doors! It's just too unpleasant. Except for that problem, we really enjoyed our stay there--but I wouldn't go back unless I knew they had replaced the doors!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: GEL1979
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, my fiancee and I stayed at the Omni for 3 nights in August as our last stop traveling the California coast from San Francisco. The Omni was a beautiful hotel and we enjoyed our stay. The lobby and room were very clean and well kept, and we really liked the modern feel. The room was quiet and enjoyable, and we enjoyed taking advantage of the complimentary beverage service, as all 3 mornings we were there, we had coffee and juice waiting outside our door right at the time that we requested on the cards the evening before. We weren't bothered by the trains or any other noise, and slept quite well in the super comfy beds.
