We were very thankful that the Omni had accommodated these requests -- and were even able to check in as early as 7:30 am, as we took the first flight out of San Francisco. The room was simply elegant and modern. From the cool alarm clock that my daughter was itching to play with, to the funky sliding bathroom door which did not pose a problem to us. In fact, my daughter had a blast peeking through that 1 inch gap whenever me or my husband would be in the bathroom! While I loved the plentiful shelves in the bathroom, my husband was impressed with the nice balcony (not an open one) that you can just gaze out endlessly to the game next door. Again, this is while my kid goes on and off the weighing scale in the bathroom, which is also a nice touch. Housekeeping did an excellent job in maintaining our rooms spotless throughout our stay. Room always smelled fresh and new, and even in the hallways as you come out from the elevator. Equally good was the turndown service that you get every night -- mint chocolates with next day's weather forecast on your pillow, dimmed lights, plus a soothing Omni channel on the TV that plays as you enter your room at night. The doormen in the morning and evening (Dave and Anthony, respectively) were very friendly and would always ask us where we are going for the day or where we have been. The valet guys (though we only used the service for a night) also had smiles for us whenever we come back to the hotel. Concierge, as expected, was courteous and knowledgeable with just about everything we needed to know about the area. The Front Desk were all very pleasant. I was surprised though at check-in that I was not asked for identification when i registered. Being a Front Desk agent myself, I found that kinda strange since my reservation has already been prepaid. Oh well,... =) My 2 complaints -- which are not much: 1. we were not able to get our complimentary morning beverage as shared by other TA reviewers. Though I signed up for the Select Guest membership prior to my stay, I was informed by the Front Desk that I need to have stayed previously in an Omni property to enjoy that particular service. Funny, but we got the other amenities/service (late checkout, morning paper, turndown service) that came along with the Select Guest membership. 2. fee to rent a fridge is $25/night. since we were staying for 8 nights, i don't think i can afford to pay $200 just to keep my daughter's milk from going stale. so we just made do of the ice bucket to serve that purpose. Overall, the hotel was an excellent base for our sightseeing activities in San Diego. Initially, we thought we were out of place seeing all the convention people staying in the hotel! But then we realize that we made the right choice and we are very happy to have stayed in one of the best hotels, if not the best, in San Diego. Thank you for making our vacation very memorable, Omni San Diego. Highly recommeded!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: stonemanmb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from a WONDERFUL weekend in San Diego. We stayed at the OMNI From Sept 23-25 (Friday thru Sunday). The pampering started from the minute we arrived. The minute we pulled up to the hotel, the valet was opening my door and the bellman was taking our luggage out of the car. Check-in was a breeze. I told them my last name, and they handed me the keys, and that was that. No forms to fill out or anything of that sort. When we arrived in the room, music was playing, and to our surprise, there was a bottle of champaigne with 2 glasses and a card wishing me a happy birthday. I have stayed at many hotels all around the world, and this is the first to do anything like this. It was awesome. Some tips about staying at the hotel: 1. Make sure you register for the Select Guest program!!!! It gives you the opportunity to have complimentary beverages and a newspaper in the morning, as well as a late check-out up until 5pm. That was a great help for us since we didn't want to leave until the evening. Also, the select guest membership gives you deals and special rates for later days. 2. I highly reccomend the Valet parking ($24/night), due to the unlimited in/out privelages. Make sure to call down to the valet on your way down, and when you get outside your car will be there waiting. 3. The breakfast Buffet at the restaurant is also very good. We had a seat at the window on Sunday morning, and just loved it! We can't wait to go back to the OMNI Hotel San Diego. It's the best location, best service, and nicest hotel in town

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful view to the west”
Reviews.Author: meravard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Omni Hotel for 3 days. This was a business/pleasure trip which included meetings, a ballgame and sightseeing. We were extremely pleased with the beautiful view from our room on the 18th floor( to the west )overlooking the trolley, convention center and activities in the harbor. The hotel is easily reached from the airport by taxi, the access to Petco Park was a dream and the room was well designed, well appointed and very clean. We had excellent service from check-in, concierge, bell captain and check-out. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: fisherprice
Reviews.Content: Just spent Labor Day Weekend at the Omni San Diego for our anniversary. Paid one hundred twenty dollars per night (including taxes and fees) via that name your own price website; at check-in, paid an extra thirty dollars per night for an upgrade to a premium room with a view of the bay. We liked the location at the tail end of the Gaslamp Quarter. Since there were no games at Petco during our stay, I decided to park our rental car on the street. With the exception of having to get out of bed early on Saturday to feed the meter till we felt like really waking up, it was relatively painless-- just remember that once meters aren't enforced (after 6 pm, Sundays, holidays), you can park in yellow zones (and there are a lot of those around the hotel). The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. The pool area was stylish. The concierge was quite helpful. We nibbled at happy hour at the McCormick and Schmick's in the lobby and were generally pleased-- be warned that it's not the same happy hour menu as at the M&S in downtown Los Angeles. I've also stayed at the Sheraton in downtown San Diego and felt that the Omni had better service, better rooms, and a better location. I subtracted one star for the annoyingly low water pressure in the shower, the not-really-a-door bathroom door that someone else mentioned, and the somewhat clueless desk staff who took my credit card then tried to check me into someone else's room. Note: if you are under 40 and enjoy breakfast, the Hash House A Go Go on Fifth Avenue in the Hillcrest area is absolutely required... despite the long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Omni was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: game_mom
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Beautiful view of the bay. Exquisite decor throughout the hotel. Gorgeous pool area with super comfy lounges. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. Bathroom door was unique, but fit right in with the euro design of the room. Toiletries and robes were first-class. Nightly turn down service with fresh bathroom linens and chocolates was a nice touch. Since we had tickets to a Padres game, we loved being able to walk right into the park. No lines - you could leave and come back as often as needed (to get a light jacket or sweatshirt for the cool evening). Be sure to sign up for the Select Guest membership for 50% off one-night stay and/or free room upgrade. And yes, the valet parking is $24; but you can leave and come back as much as you need during that time with no hassles. Just call from your room and they have your car waiting for you by the time you hit the lobby. Can't wait to go back already!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Make This Your Padre Headquarters”
Reviews.Author: chisox05
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for three wonderful nights and we'd definitely come back here. Since this is a brand new hotel everything is shiny and clean. The staff was friendly and courteous. The concierge was very helpful in arranging a rental car for us and even told us that we should be able to easily find free street parking in the evening (no game the night we had the car) to avoid the hotel parking fee. There's no better place to stay if you're going to a Padre game. The skywalk between the hotel and ballpark is an escalator from the lobby and takes you right into the main concourse of the ballpark. Use of the skywalk is limited to hotel guests so you're not fighting through a throng of people to use it either. We could even see left field from our room. Lots of interesting baseball memorabilia in display cases around the hotel add to the ballpark atmosphere. The pool was small, but refreshing. We didn't use the fitness center, but I took a look and there is a lot of top notch equipment. My only disappointment was that lack of dining and bar choices. They only have one restaurant, McCormick and Schmidt, and while the food was excellent and reasonably priced it would have been nice to have at least one more option. Of course, you can easily walk to many more eateries in the Gaslamp Quarter. You can also easily hop on the San Diego trolley that stops just outside the hotel. What made our stay escpecially enjoyable was that we booked the room through Priceline at a bargain $95/night!

Reviews.Title: “Choose your weapons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1-Book early and get the best rates directly at the hotel website. 2-Ask for a "corner" room. These are much more spacious than other rooms. Rooms are nicely done in the contemporary semi-minimal taste du jour. 3-Parking is a real ripoff-- $24 to $27 dlls. But it is also a ripoff in all the lots around the hotel, courtesy of the baseball stadium which is actually connected to the hotel. Parking next door may save you some bucks, but not a lot. 4-If you don't come here for baseball, consider avoiding dates when a game takes place. The whole area is closed off for (and overwhelmed by) the thousands of fans.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMiram
Reviews.Content: We (My husband, myself and our two daughters) had a wonderful weekend stay at the Omni San Diego. It is in a Terrific location (close to the trolley and located in the gaslamp district). The staff is excellent. The room was clean, well furnished and quiet (we stayed in a suite on the 12th floor). The view was fabulous. We were able to walk to Petco Park via a bridge to go to the baseball game (very convenient). We purchased a great package that included our valet parking and breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel (great deal). My only complaint and it is a minor one, is the size of the pool -- very small. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: paluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Very nice staff, very clean hotel. Valet parking a little expensive (especially when there is a garage right across the street) but well worth the price! Very friendly valet attendents. Our car was always ready for us right outside the doors. Conceirge was helpful and friendly. Loved the complimentary breakfast beverages!! What a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “you don't get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a three night stay at the Omni through Expedia.Paid an extra $25 a night for a premium room with two double beds, a balcony, view of the bay and downtown skyline. First room no balcony and a view of a roof top. Second room no balcony and a sliding bathroom door that's a half inch shorter than the opening. I was told the hotel only offers a balcony with a king size bed and they were not responsible for what was listed on the Expedia website. A king size bed was unacceptable since my 23yr old daughter was staying with us. Expedia said the hotel maintains all the information on the website. The hotel offered to comp the vallet parking to make up for the discrepancy with the room since they couldn't change the rate. I didn't use the valet parking the first night because you can park across the street for $11 per day .They also claim I was the first to complain about the bathroom door. I said maybe they do things different in calif. but when I use the facility I like total privacy. In addition construction was going on across the street. Who needs a wakeup call when you can hear a bulldozer at 8am. I would not stay here again, at this price there are better hotels to select.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back here again!”
Reviews.Author: Angelo67
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a romantic weekend getaway to San Diego and staying in this wonderful hotel made the experience so much more enjoyable. The rooms are very well appointed and special attention to details are apparent everywhere, from the coffee cup to the toilettries. The bathroom design and hardware are top notch and very classy. Complimentary coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice delivered to your room with newspaper in the morning made the stay even more special. Add $3 for croissant which is really good, but don't bother with the tiny muffin. The matress is just as good as Westin's heavenly bed. The staff is very efficient and the location is very convenient, with gaslamp quarter & seaport village within walking distance, as well as trolley stop right next to the hotel. This is our first time staying at an Omni and we'll definitely come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Perfect service and perfectly clean. You were made to feel welcome and knew you were being taken care of. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The rooms are spacious and clean. The Bell and Front Office staff helpful and full of great recommendations. The views are great. Valet parking is pricey, but there is a garage you can park in across the street. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: lunchtime
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending three nights at the Omni and we are still talking about how wonderful everything was! The service at this hotel was top-notch. The moment we pulled up to the Valet, everyone was so friendly, courteous and went out of their way to help you and make you feel welcome. Check-in was a breeze, our hotel room was gorgeous, very nice size and the bed was so comfortable. Concierge was incredibly helpful. The fitness center, while it wasn't huge, had very modern, up-to-date equipment and provided headphones for the individual TV's, fruit, water and towels. While we did not lounge by the pool, we did take a peek and it looked wonderful! As an Omni Select Guest member (which you can join free, by the way) you get complimentary juice, cofffee, tea or hot chocolate in the morning, delivered to your door at the time you request. We really enjoyed that nice touch! The drinks were always delivered on time, along the newspaper of your choice. Also, the location of the hotel was perfect. Close to the Gas Lamp district and all the restaurants and shops. I've stayed at a number of 5-star hotels and I have to say, the Omni ranks right up there with the kind of service you'd receive at a 5-star hotel. We will definitely be back. It's the only place we'll stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Propery”
Reviews.Author: SteveBazakas
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful places I've stayed in. The rooms are large and modern. It is very close to the Gaslight district, and an easy base to hit the zoo, Seaworld, and restaurants around the water. Be sure to sign up for the frequent guest program before you go. Check-in took two seconds, and you get complimentary beverages delivered to your room in the morning. To this, you can add a bagel, croissant, etc, for $3, which is a room service steal! Be prepared to spend $24(?) for valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price / If the price is below $200 a night!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at Omni San Diego the week of August 8th. Will be back next week for 7 days. Price-- Four days average of approximately $190 a night plus parking-- parking can range from $8 to $24 Valet park- depending on if the Padres are playing or not. Pros-- Nice, clean, quite hotel with friendly staff Price-- For $190 during peak season (August) it is worth it Location-- about 1 block away from Convention center and main drag of Gaslamp district-- If you like the Padres there is a skywalk that connects the hotel with the stadium Pool/deck-- the pool/deck on the 6th floor is very nice and overlooks Coranado- there is a very nice fire place in the middle -- also -- also a bar Gym/Fitness area-- very clean with large LCD tv's-- very good for basic aerobic workouts and a little weight training (if you are a body builder - it is not the best but for the basic traveler it is very nice Wireless-- the entire hotel --lobby, pool, pool deck, rooms, etc.. is wireless which is great for business travel and FREE Morsels-- Nice little coffee shop in the lobby with great hours Restaurant--- Only had breakfast so far but it was very good Traffic-- virtually no traffic in the town of San Diego -- I guess most of the business is outside the city limits Noise-- Many of the reviews say it is loud but we stayed on the 11th floor in a basic room and I did not hear much at all Cons-- Parking-- The parking is hit or miss-- if there is a Padres home stand they do not let you in the self park area (only $8 a day) during the game-- YOU MUST VALET PARK during the game wich is $24 bucks plus tip Parking-- If you pull into the garage during the game it is $10 up front then $8 when you leave Hotel room size vs. value-- For a three star hotel (in my opinion price under $225 a night it is well worth it. If you pay over $225 a night for the Omni and don't get an upgrade or a suite in my opinion the rooms are slightly too small -- that being said-- the rooms (basic) are small but nice and Omni select guests get free beverages (including Peetes coffee) every morning delivered to your room Summary--- Very nice hotel for the price (I paid $188 a night)-- In my opinion a three star plus hotel -- 3.25 stars I have stayed in hotels such as the New York Palace (one of my favorites) in New York ( 4 star-5 star) which costs a lot more but the Omni is San Diego is worth it if you pay under $225 a night -- The only big problem is Parking during a Padres game so if you are staying during a home stand be aware -- Friendly staff and good customer service -- so far Close to all major highway-- three lefts out of the parking garage -- go to market street and then find the highway-- very easy Good luck !

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons of the Omni San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mrwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here by chance. The Marriott Marina, which is down the street, was sold out. So I read the reviews here about the Omni and decided to stay here. This is a great hotel. The rooms are a nice size and are very nicely decorated. The rooms have large flat-screen TVs and free high-speed Internet service (both wired and wireless). I had a corner room with a balcony facing south and a picture window facing west. There is a 24-hour gym on the 6th floor with several cardio and weight machines. The hotel offers valet parking for $24/night, or you can self-park in the garage across the street for $14/night. My only disappointment was with the food. The food in the hotel's restaurant, McCormick & Schmick's, was only mediocre and the service was a little slow. I've been to other M&S locations where the food and service was much better. Also, the hotel claims to have 24-hour room service. But when my girlfriend and I attempted to order food at 3am late Sat night, we were told that everything on the late-night menu was sold out, except for the caesar salad. We ended up going hungry. Other than that, I enjoyed the stay very much. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: TAFriend
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Hotel in San Diego over the Fourth of July weekend for our one year anniversary. We loved the room! It was very modern looking and the bed was the most comfortable bed ever! Our room looked out over the pool, which we liked. It was a pretty view and we didn't hear any noise from the kids in the pool. The hotel's staff was very friendly and helpful. They did everything from booking us dinner reservations to getting us discount Zoo tickets. One of the best things about the hotel was it's location. One of the best things about the hotel was it's location. We loved the close proximity to Petco Park. We went and saw a game one night and found the pedestrian walk way connecting the hotel to the park very convenient. Also, the hotel is located at the end of the Gaslamp Quarter. So every night, we could walk to just about any restaurant we could possibly want. There's also great shopping in the Gaslamp and a movie theater.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: uknowbeers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 7/20-22, 2005 for $94/night. It was built in 2004 and is right across the street from the San Diego Padres' Petco Field. It's adjacent to the city's Gaslamp district and the convention center, and the area is under revitalization. It has a pretty good location downtown, although the Manchester Grand Hyatt has a better location right next to the harbor. The Omni sits directly next to the San Diego Trolley's tracks, so you may want a room not close to the tracks. Ours faced the ballpark, and we could see the outfield while we were there. The Padres were on an East Coast trip, so there was no game. I can imagine that trying to get back to the hotel from a tourist site (the zoo, La Jolla, etc.) would be extremely difficult right after a baseball game. The parking is valet only at an outrageous $25/day. The front desk staff and bellman were very helpful. Other than some bad directions from one valet, the valet parking service was good. We were given a two queen, non-smoking room as requested. It had a flat-screen (not flat-panel) TV and DVD player. It also had very nice beds. The bathroom's door is a rolling door that doesn't close tightly on each side. So if you were nosy, you could peek through to parts of the bathroom. I used the business center. Internet access was $5.95 for 15 minute increments. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a solid 4*. Its going rate was around $200/night for the busy summer tourism season. I feel that $94 + $25 parking is a lot to spend per night. Most hotels in San Diego were going for peak summer season prices, so it was a good price for the quality. Many of the rack rates for Hotel Circle 3*’s were around $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish”
Reviews.Author: chikina
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Omni, San Diego. We stayed on the 15th floor facing the stadium and the parking garage. We didn't hear any noise and the view was nice. The beds were very comfortable with down blankets and pillows. We paid $120 per night plus tax for a room through priceline which we thought excellent value. Good airconditioning in the room. Very good housekeeping services. They were going extra mile with everything and even let us use their minibar frige for our food. As a selective guests we were receiving our drinks in the morning. We recommend an orange juice, it is freshly squeezed and delicious. Location is very convenient to everything. Just a short beautiful walk to the Seaport Village. We enjoyed pool and JYM. Expensive valet parking can be substituted with self park at the same garage for $8, a little extra on the weekend. Overall I would say this is a very good hotel and I am extremely picky!

Reviews.Title: “High Tech Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights, July 10 -13, 2005. The hotel is new, just opened a year ago, and it looks it - very plush, clean hallways, new furnishings. Free wifi and ethernet. Flat screen tv. Speaker phone. My husband was in heaven with all the high tech stuff. The elevators were a little weird. You had to wait a long time for an elevator, even though there are six. They were usually too crowded to get in. It is in a good location. Service was good. It is across the street from the convention center and a short walk to the gaslight district. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Awell003
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really great. I stayed for a whole week rooms were very confortable and 100% clean. There is wireless connection all over the building. There is only one restautarant McCormick&Schmick, which is very good. The fitness center is also very complete.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: abd
Reviews.Content: Pros: new, clean hotel convenient location in Gaslamp area and attached to Petco great restaurant nicely decorated valet pick-up is fast good package rate ($189/night included breakfast) Select Guest members get free morning beverages and paper delivered promptly at time requested Cons: can hear lots of outside noise (construction, trolley, bars, etc.) even on the 21st floor $24 per day for valet parking even with no ball game bathroom fan on continuously, rather loud room had strange odor coming from a/c was supposed to get phone call from concierge prior to arrival, did not

Reviews.Title: “Location & Hotel is great but..........”
Reviews.Author: Simbirsk
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before I booked into the Omni and found that they were relatively accurate. Great staff, nice rooms with a new feel to them. Newspapers delivered in the morning, room service was on target, pool area and gym were nice. Cool TV's with DVD players, nice carpeting, large modern showers etc....The Location to the Omni could not be beat for any "Downtown" San Diego Experience. I went to two Ballgames and was able to come and go through the hotel entrance. The Trolley to all parts San Diego as well as Tijuana stops right there. The border took 30 minutes for a small $ 3.00 all-day fare. The Omni sits at the mouth of the Gaslamp district, so all of your nightlife and dining spots are easily walked to. Seaport Village is also a walkable distance as is the convention center and Horton Plaza for shopping. A $ 10 cab ride will take you to the Maritime Museum with the U.S.S. Midway and Star Of India as well as a cool Russian Submarine. The ONLY and somewhat major annoyance for me was the NOISE from the streets outside the hotel. I had read about this from reviews and specifically asked to be placed on a higher-up floor. Even up on the 12th floor I was STILL awakened each morning by garbage trucks, trains and police sirens. Very aggravating. They should find a better time schedule to get their trash collected. You do NOT need a rental car and be warned the valet charges are quite expensive at the Omni. There are plenty of Pedi-cabs and taxis if you get really tired of walking. In the end, the location was what will make me consider returning.(with earplugs). It was a decent deal via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: stretched2thin
Reviews.Content: My 2 favorite things about the hotel: 1) friendliness 2) rooftop pool and hot tub The concierge, the bellboys, the valets, all were extremely personable, helpful, and friendly. Very professional. Always remembered us. Went out of their way to help us with our needs. I don't think you could have slapped the smile off the concierge's face. The rooms were upscale and clean. We had a gorgeous view from the 10th floor of the Bay. I highly recommend you request a Bay view. The free in-room safe was ample and a nice perq that we took advantage of by using. The beds were heavenly to sink into. It's a great location, convenient to lovely fountains, and an easy walk to nearby Seaport Village, where there are lovely outdoor restaurants and shops. I absolutely loved the 6th floor rooftop pool and hot tub. Definitely not enough chairs for the guests, though. Wonderful spot to sit and have a drink. I would also bring my kids to this hotel and enjoy the pool. Hotel is kid friendly. Price kindof high.

HotelInfo.Name: Omni San Diego Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 675 L Street, San Diego, CA 92101
